0.title: Shaktimaan has all kinds of powers, can do everything: Mukesh Khanna
0.article_body: Actor Mukesh Khanna has said, "If you compare with the powers of any superhero, maybe Iron Man, Spider-Man or Superman...Shaktimaan can do everything." He added that 'Shaktimaan' has all kinds of powers because he's made from five elements of the universe. Mukesh Khanna added that the upcoming film 'Shaktimaan' will be a trilogy.

1.title: Kane scores 176th PL goal, overtakes Henry in all-time PL scoring list
1.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur's Harry Kane on Monday scored his 176th Premier League goal, overtaking former Arsenal striker Thierry Henry's tally of 175. Kane is now sixth on the all-time Premier League scoring list. "Thierry was one of the greatest strikers we have seen, so it's nice to go above him in the scorers list and hopefully they keep coming," Kane said.

2.title: Toothbrush pierces woman's cheek & gets stuck after she falls, removed post surgery in TN
2.article_body: A 34-year-old Tamil Nadu woman had to go through surgery after a plastic toothbrush was stuck inside her cheek when she slipped and fell in her bathroom while brushing. Ekamai Revathi fell sideways, which led to the brush piercing through her cheek. It was stuck in a manner that she couldn't open or close her mouth or scream for help.

3.title: Western nations didn’t save our cities, although they can: Ukraine Prez
3.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has blamed the West for not saving Ukraine's cities and civilians from Russian bombs, although they can. He said, "While Russians are to blame for...killings, responsibility is shared by those who for 13 days in their Western offices haven't been able to approve...necessary decision." He has demanded Western powers to enforce a no-fly zone over Ukraine.

4.title: 5 teens rape 2 minor girls in Bihar after watching porn on phone
4.article_body: 5 teenage boys allegedly gang-raped 2 minor girls on Monday evening in Barbigha police station area in Bihar, police said on Tuesday. The survivor's family caught two of the accused and handed them over to the police. During the investigation, the boys allegedly admitted that they committed the crime after watching porn videos on a smartphone.

5.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal honours transgender activist Gauri Sawant
5.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday honoured Gauri Sawant, a transgender activist from Mumbai who has been helping transgender people. Sawant's petition in the Supreme Court helped in the recognition of transgender as the third gender. Kejriwal also lauded the Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) for instilling a sense of security among women in the national capital.

6.title: DCW has instilled sense of security among women of Delhi: Kejriwal
6.article_body: Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday hailed the Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) for its work, saying it has instilled a sense of security among women in the capital. While speaking at the International Women's Day Awards function hosted by the DCW, Kejriwal said that the women know they can contact 181 (DCW helpline) if they face any injustice.

7.title: Paraglider loses balance in Himachal, tourist & helper killed
7.article_body: A tourist and a helper died, while a pilot was injured in a paragliding accident in Himachal Pradesh's Bir Billing, ANI reported. The incident took place when the helper who pushes the paraglider for take-off got tangled and was launched into the air along with them. Due to this, the paraglider lost balance.

8.title: Video shows Russian tank blowing up civilian car, killing elderly couple in Ukraine
8.article_body: A video has surfaced online, allegedly showing a Russian tank blowing up a civilian car and killing an elderly couple in Ukraine. The video shows the car coming to a stop before the tank fired at it. Another video of the incident shows the elderly man's body in the driver's seat, with the elderly woman's head resting on his shoulder.

9.title: Seize opportunity to export best quality wheat: PM Modi amid war
9.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine has increased the demand for India's wheat globally and this opportunity should be seized to export the best quality product. He said that the financial sector, import-export departments and shipping industry should make a "comprehensive effort" to help wheat and other exporters.

10.title: Haryana budget is a 'jugglery of words': Former CM Hooda
10.article_body: Former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Tuesday described the budget presented by the BJP-led government as a "jugglery of words". Hooda further said that the government has cut economic progress and infrastructure budget by 3% even at a time of record unemployment. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar presented the budget estimates for 2022-23 on Tuesday.

11.title: Former Ukrainian Prez Yanukovych tells Zelenskyy to 'stop the war'
11.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine tensions, ex-Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych has urged President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to "stop the war". Yanukovych, who's in exile in Russia since being ousted from power in 2014, has said that Zelenskyy should reach a peaceful consensus on the conflict. Notably, Ukrainian media recently reported that Russia wants to reinstate Yanukovych as Ukraine's leader after the war.

12.title: SC declines to hear plea seeking VVPAT verification before counting
12.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to urgently hear a plea seeking the verification of Voter Verified Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) before the counting of votes. "Let counting go on as per established practice," SC said. It said it would list the matter before an appropriate bench after counting is finished for Assembly polls.

13.title: Let's dedicate ACM Awards 2022 to people in Ukraine: Dolly Parton
13.article_body: Amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict, singer Dolly Parton voiced her support for the people in Ukraine while hosting the 57th Academy of Country Music Awards (ACM Awards 2022). "I want us to send our love and hope to our brothers and sisters in Ukraine," she said. She added, "Let's dedicate this whole show to them and pray for peace around this...world."

14.title: There's no alternative to PM Modi: WB BJP chief to Mamata Banerjee
14.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Tuesday said there's no alternative to PM Modi after CM Mamata Banerjee claimed that BJP will be ousted from power once people find a viable alternative. "Such a big target isn't good for [TMC's] health," Majumdar said. Earlier, Banerjee called BJP a "dangabaaz (rioter) and corrupt party" that wants to "destroy democracy".

15.title: Trained exactly like male colleagues: India's 1st female Rafale pilot
15.article_body: India's first female Rafale fighter pilot Flight Lieutenant Shivangi Singh said, "I've been trained exactly like my male colleagues". Speaking on the occasion of International Women's Day, Singh added, "The machine doesn't recognize gender, it acts as per the inputs given to it." She said the experience of becoming a fighter pilot has been thrilling and satisfying.

16.title: Resign in 24 hours: Pak Opposition to PM Imran Khan over poor governance
16.article_body: Pakistan's Opposition parties have moved a no-confidence motion seeking the ouster of PM Imran Khan and accused him of mismanaging the economy and poor governance. "Resign in 24 hours...face us in...election," Pakistan Peoples Party leader Bilawal Bhutto said during a rally. Meanwhile, Imran Khan vowed to fight any move to unseat him, saying, "Whatever they do, I'm ready for that."

17.title: 3 LeT terrorists arrested in J&K's Pulwama, grenade recovered
17.article_body: Three terrorists associated with the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) have been arrested in J&K's Pulwama. Local police, along with 55 RR (Rashtriya Rifles) and 182 battalion of the CRPF, also recovered a grenade, 13 rounds of AK-47 and some incriminating material from their possession following the arrests. A senior police official said that the trio were terrorist Arif Hazar's associates.

18.title: Use own weapons in future wars: Indian Army chief on 'lesson' from Russia-Ukraine war
18.article_body: Speaking about the lessons India learnt from Russia-Ukraine war, Chief of the Army Staff MM Naravane said, "Biggest lesson is we've to be ready to fight future wars with indigenous weapons." "Steps towards Aatmanirbhar Bharat in defence have to be taken more urgently. Wars of future should be fought with own weapon systems," he added.

19.title: Man rapes & kills 9-yr-old after luring her with snacks in Aligarh
19.article_body: A man allegedly raped and murdered a nine-year-old girl after luring her with snacks in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. The victim was reportedly bludgeoned to death with a brick by the accused, who was reportedly her uncle. Police arrested the man and said that he is a drug addict and was found in a semi-conscious state.

20.title: Ukraine running short of vital medical supplies amid war: WHO
20.article_body: The World Health Organization said on Tuesday that attacks on hospitals, ambulances and other health care facilities in Ukraine have increased rapidly, adding that nine people had died in 16 attacks on health care facilities since the start of a Russian invasion of Ukraine. The WHO further said the war-hit Ukraine is running short of vital medical supplies, including oxygen.

21.title: Suspended BJP leader Jay Prakash Majumdar joins TMC
21.article_body: Suspended BJP leader Jay Prakash Majumdar joined Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Tuesday in the presence of party supremo and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. He was also appointed as TMC's state Vice President. Majumdar, along with BJP leader Ritesh Tiwari, had been issued show-cause notices by BJP in January for alleged anti-party activities and were later suspended.

22.title: Actor dies fighting Russia in Ukraine; his last Instagram post shows him in army uniform
22.article_body: Ukrainian actor Pasha Lee, who decided to defend the country by joining the Territorial Defence Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine amid Russian invasion, has been killed in Russian shelling. In his last post a few days ago, the 33-year-old shared a picture of himself in a military uniform and wrote, "We are smiling because we will manage."

23.title: Man tied up with his pants down after he's caught stealing in Ukraine amid war
23.article_body: A man who was allegedly caught looting in Kyiv during Russian attacks on the city was tied to a lamp post with his pants down as punishment. He was pictured standing near a petrol station in Ukraine's capital, unable to move after being caught by locals. There have been reports of looting in areas across Ukraine since the invasion began.

24.title: A tragedy we will never come to terms with: Shane Warne's parents on his demise
24.article_body: Releasing a statement following the death of Shane Warne, the Australian cricket legend's parents Keith and Brigitte said that his demise is a tragedy they will never come to terms with. "Looking to a future without Shane is inconceivable, hopefully the mountain of happy memories we all have will help us cope with our ongoing grief," they added.

25.title: EVMs stolen in Varanasi, SP workers stopped truck: Akhilesh as video surfaces
25.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday alleged that EVMs are being stolen in Varanasi. He also claimed that SP workers intercepted a truck full of EVMs, a video of which has surfaced. "We need to be alert if EVMs are being transported," he added. Meanwhile, Varanasi DM Kaushal Raj Sharma claimed these EVMs were being used for training.

26.title: India promoting greater roles for girls in armed forces: PM Modi
26.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on International Women's Day said the country is promoting greater roles for girls in the armed forces and now the admission of girls has started in Sainik Schools. He was virtually addressing a seminar in Gujarat's Kutch. "Today the priority of the country lies in the full participation of women in India's development journey," he added.

27.title: 4 security personnel killed, 20 others injured in blast in Pakistan
27.article_body: Four security personnel were killed and over 20 were injured in a blast in Pakistan's Balochistan, according to police. The blast occurred in Balochistan's Sibi district, where the annual Sibi mela was being held. "It took place after Pakistan President Arif Alvi attended the festival in Sibi," Hafeez Rind, a senior official of Counter-Terrorism Department Sibi was quoted as saying.

28.title: When you're passionate about your craft, you want to reinvent: Divya
28.article_body: Actress Divya Dutta said she's being offered roles that she had never portrayed before. Divya added people wanted to do glamorous roles in earlier times, however, they are now opting for story-oriented roles. "The range of roles being offered have become bigger and better," she stated. Divya added, "When you are passionate about your craft, you always want to reinvent."

29.title: US CDC urges citizens to avoid travel to NZ, Hong Kong & Thailand
29.article_body: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Monday urged citizens to avoid travel to New Zealand, Hong Kong and Thailand due to rising COVID-19 cases. The CDC updated its travel recommendation for all three countries to its highest level, "Level Four: Very High". India is currently on the CDC's third level, "Level Three: High".

30.title: Our goal is to forge a non-BJP front in Goa: Cong's Chidambaram
30.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said Congress is open to an alliance with anti-BJP parties and that talks regarding the same have begun. "Our goal is to forge a non-BJP front and such efforts are going on in other parts of India," he said. This comes a day after a majority of the exit polls predicted a hung assembly in Goa.

31.title: We'll punish everyone who committed atrocities in war: Ukraine Prez
31.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has warned that the country will "not forgive or forget the premeditated murder" being carried out by Russian President Vladimir Putin and his forces. He said, "We will not forgive. We will not forget. We will punish everyone who committed atrocities in this war." "[Instead] of forgiveness there will be a day of judgment," he added.

32.title: Global COVID-19 death toll passes 6 million mark: Reports
32.article_body: The global COVID-19 death toll on Monday passed 6 million as per data collected by Johns Hopkins University in the US. The last one million COVID-19 deaths reportedly occurred in the past four months. Due to poor record-keeping and testing in several parts of the world, many experts believe the six million figure is lower than the actual death count.

33.title: Porn content on social media responsible for rape of minor girls: Raj minister
33.article_body: Rajasthan minister Shanti Kumar Dhariwal on Tuesday blamed pornographic content available on social media for rape of minor girls. "Inhuman tendency is being developed among youth and obscene content on social media is the main reason for this. This content is...served in an unrestricted manner," he said. Rajasthan recorded 5,793 cases of rape of minor girls in last three years.

34.title: Cong to move its candidates to resort before Goa poll result: Reports
34.article_body: Ahead of the Goa Assembly poll result on March 10 (Thursday), all Congress candidates will be staying in a resort in North Goa on Wednesday, reports said. The Congress candidates will be heading towards the counting stations from the resort, as per the reports. This comes after exit polls predicted a hung Assembly in Goa.

35.title: Will support Poland if it decides to send jets to Ukraine: UK
35.article_body: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Tuesday said Britain would support Poland if it decided to send fighter jets to Ukraine. "I would support the Poles and whatever choice they make," he said. Wallace added Britain would not be able to offer Ukraine any aircraft. "We would protect Poland, we'll help them with anything that they need," he said.

36.title: All Indian students moved out of Ukraine's Sumy: Govt as it shares video
36.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Tuesday tweeted, "Happy to inform that we have been able to move out all Indian students from Sumy. They are currently en route to Poltava, from where they will board trains to western Ukraine." Sharing a video of students, Bagchi added that Operation Ganga flights are being prepared to bring them home.

37.title: BJP's exit from UP is certain: Tejashwi Yadav ahead of poll results
37.article_body: Reacting to exit polls on UP Assembly elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that the BJP's departure from UP is certain. "The anger we have seen amongst the people for the [UP] government clearly gives the message that [BJP] is not going to win and Akhilesh Ji will form the government," Yadav added.

38.title: Child dies of dehydration in Ukraine's city after days without water or power
38.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Tuesday a child had died from dehydration in Ukraine's besieged city of Mariupol, which has had no water, power or heating supplies for days. "In 2022, from dehydration," Zelenskyy said in a video address, likening the crisis linked to Russian bombardment of Ukrainian cities to that created by Nazi invasion during World War Two.

39.title: Nearly 18,000 Indians brought back from Ukraine since Feb 22: Govt
39.article_body: The Ministry of Civil Aviation informed on Tuesday that nearly 18,000 Indians have been repatriated from war-hit Ukraine since February 22. "The number of Indians airlifted by 75 special civilian flights goes up to 15,521. IAF had flown 12 missions to bring back 2,467 passengers, as part of the Operation Ganga," it added. Twenty-eight flights were operated from Budapest.

40.title: Mumbai Police probing extortion charges against 4 ED officers: Raut
40.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has said the Mumbai Police were investigating extortion charges against four Enforcement Directorate officers, adding that "some of them will go to jail". He said, "ED and some of its officials have become...ATM for...BJP." His remarks come on a day when Income Tax department conducted raids on premises linked to Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray's aide.

41.title: TMC could've done better if we had more time: Mamata on Goa polls
41.article_body: Ahead of Goa Assembly poll results, Trinamool Congress (TMC) supremo Mamata Banerjee said on Tuesday that party could've done better if it had more time. "I'm happy that we were able to reach out to every family in Goa with our logo [but]...We...started late," she added. TMC had previously said it's open to post-poll alliance with like-minded parties in Goa.

42.title: Ukraine war may have limited impact on domestic credit market: Report
42.article_body: An India Ratings and Research (IRR) report said Russia-Ukraine war's impact on the domestic credit market may be limited as the banking system has adequate liquidity. The duration and intensity of the war will be the key determinant for the macro and micro risks. Entities with a weak financial profile may face financing challenges if the situation worsens, it added.

43.title: Fire breaks out at Delhi plastic factory, 100 firefighters deployed
43.article_body: A fire broke out at a plastic factory in Delhi's Bawana area on Tuesday morning. According to officials, the fire broke out at 6:30 am when 50 workers were present inside. Delhi Fire Service said they deployed 25 fire tenders and 100 firefighters to the spot. Officials said they also used a drone in the firefighting operation.

44.title: House of suspect raided by NIA in Pune's Kondhwa over ISKP case
44.article_body: A suspect's house was raided by the NIA in connection with a case of planning terrorist attacks in India. Officials said searches were conducted at 38-year-old Talha Khan's residence in Kondhwa, Pune, on Monday over propagating terrorist group ISIS' ideology as part of outlawed Islamic State Khorasan Province (ISKP) activities. Various incriminating documents and digital devices were seized.

45.title: My life is guided by women: Shahid on mother Neliima and wife Mira
45.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, actor Shahid Kapoor took to Instagram and posted a picture of his mother Neliima Azeem and wife Mira Kapoor. "These two are enough for me to know how much...my life is guided, supported...by women," Shahid captioned his post. "Here's to every woman...You all make this world a much better place," he added.

46.title: CBFC passes 'The Kashmir Files' with 7 cuts & 'A' certificate
46.article_body: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) passed 'The Kashmir Files' with an 'A' certificate. The film, directed by Vivek Agnihotri, was approved by the board with seven cuts and words like 'Hindu' and 'Pandit' were removed when they were associated with cuss words. The board even changed the name of the university from JNU to ANU in the film.

47.title: Trafficked woman reunited with family in Arunachal after 12 years
47.article_body: A trafficked woman was reunited with her biological family in Arunachal Pradesh after 12 years on March 7. Arunachal Women Helpline (WHL-181), which had received information about a survivor of child trafficking and domestic violence, facilitated her return. According to the woman's statement, she was just eight years old when her stepmother sold her to a person in Assam.

48.title: Haryana announces ₹5 lakh award named after Sushma Swaraj
48.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on the occasion of the International Women's Day on Tuesday announced an award named after late BJP leader Sushma Swaraj. A sum of ₹5 lakh will be given to women from Haryana who have made significant contributions. He also announced Haryana Matrushakti Udyamita Scheme to support women in becoming entrepreneurs.

49.title: Scindia carries small girl to her mother in evacuation flight, helps them with seats
49.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, who was in Romania to expedite evacuation of Indian nationals through Operation Ganga, was seen helping an Indian family with their seats in a flight. A video shows Scindia carrying a small girl to where her mother was seated in the flight after asking a passenger to swap her seat with that of the girl.

50.title: Google to buy cybersecurity firm Mandiant for $5.4 billion
50.article_body: Google on Tuesday said it would buy cybersecurity firm Mandiant at $23/share in an all-cash deal for approximately $5.4 billion. Google's offer represents a premium of about 57% to Mandiant's stock price before a report said Microsoft was planning to buy the firm. "Google Cloud shares our mission-driven culture to bring security to every organization,” said Mandiant CEO Kevin Mandia.

51.title: 2 held in Delhi for credit card fraud; 17 sim cards, 2 laptops found
51.article_body: Two persons were arrested in Delhi's Najafgarh area for allegedly cheating people in the guise of redemption of credit card points, the police said. According to the complainant, his credit card was used for three transactions worth ₹44,000 and the money was transferred to a wallet and a shopping website. Police recovered seven mobile phones, 17 SIM cards, two laptops.

52.title: Fake claims of Russia-Ukraine war being a hoax go viral
52.article_body: Theories claiming the Russia-Ukraine war is a hoax have gone viral. Some social media users claimed actors are being used to act out scenes from an attack. One such claim is in the form of a video, which shows people getting fake blood applied. The video, however, shows the preparation of a scene for Ukrainian TV series 'Contamin' in 2020.

53.title: 2 13-yr-old students beaten outside Delhi school by group of boys
53.article_body: Two 13-year-old students were allegedly beaten by a group of boys outside their school on February 28 in the Delhi Cantonment area, the police said. The boys are students of Kendriya Vidyalaya No. 2 and were returning home when the incident took place. One student sustained injuries on his head and had to get stitches, the boy's father said.

54.title: Navi Mumbai policeman goes missing after alleging senior of harassment
54.article_body: Manesh Bachhav, a Navi Mumbai police sub-inspector, has been missing since Saturday afternoon. Bachhav alleged a "corrupt" senior police inspector of harassing him and causing mental trauma, according to a letter he wrote to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and DGP Rajnish Seth. Police started an inquiry into the allegations levelled by Bachhav after his letter went viral on social media.

55.title: Delhi HC refuses to stay AAP govt's order banning discounts on liquor
55.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday refused to stay the AAP government's decision to ban discounts on liquor. Several liquor licence holders had complained against the order, saying that the rules of the game can't be changed after the game has begun. Today, Justice V Kameswar Rao said, "I am dismissing the applications...A detailed order will be uploaded."

56.title: 33% of govt jobs in Tripura will be reserved for women: Amit Shah
56.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on the occasion of International Women's Day said that 33% of government jobs in Tripura would be reserved for women. He said that for the youth of Tripura, BJP will establish a National Forensic Science University. Shah said this while addressing a rally on the completion of four years of the BJP government in Tripura.

57.title: CNG prices hiked in Delhi-NCR by up to ₹1, to cost ₹57.51/kg in Delhi
57.article_body: CNG prices have been increased in Delhi-NCR by up to ₹1 per kg with effect from Tuesday. In Delhi, one kg CNG will now be costlier by 50 paise and cost ₹57.51 from earlier ₹57.01. The prices in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad have been hiked by ₹1 per kg and CNG in these cities will cost ₹59.58 per kg.

58.title: Leave using any means of transport: Embassy to Indians in Ukraine
58.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Ukraine on Tuesday urged its nationals to use the humanitarian corridor, created for evacuation, and leave using any means of transport available while considering their safety. "The...corridor...has been announced...from 1000 hrs on March 8," it said. The embassy added that given the current situation, the creation of the next humanitarian corridor is uncertain.

59.title: Inspector Madhulatha appointed as 1st woman SHO in Hyd
59.article_body: Inspector K Madhulatha was appointed as Hyderabad's first woman Station House Officer (SHO) on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. Hyderabad also got its first woman officer to lead a law-and-order (L&O) police station in its 175-year-old history. She took charge as SHO of Lallaguda police station in the presence of Home Minister Mohammed Mahmood Ali.

60.title: Ukraine conflict could lead to 3rd world war: Venezuelan Prez Maduro
60.article_body: The military conflict in Ukraine could lead to a third world war, Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has said. "[The conflict] has global consequences, such as a devastating impact on...prices of oil, petrol and gas, on...cost of food," Maduro added. Notably, President Maduro had expressed "strong support" for Russia and condemned "destabilising actions" of the West following Ukraine's invasion.

61.title: Pub in UK installs Putin's photo in its toilets, shares pic
61.article_body: A UK pub has installed a photograph of Russian President Vladimir Putin in its toilets to take a stand against invasion of Ukraine. The photo space in the urinals of Raglan Road Irish Bar was previously occupied by former US President Donald Trump. The bar posted a photo on their Instagram account captioned, "Vladimir Putin in the men's loo."

62.title: Natasha and I lost twins in sixth month of pregnancy: Fardeen Khan
62.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan has said that his wife Natasha Madhwani suffered a lot because of IVF and added, "It's very hard on your body and your health." He further revealed that he and his wife lost twins in the sixth month of pregnancy. "It was a tough time. She did a live birth, and we lost the babies," he stated.

63.title: 52 Indian sailors stranded in Mykolaiv Port in Ukraine evacuated
63.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine on Tuesday said it intervened in the evacuation of 75 Indian sailors who were stranded in Mykolaiv Port and evacuated 52 of them on Monday. Route constraints precluded the evacuation of the remaining 23 sailors and it is attempting their evacuation on Tuesday, it added. The embassy also evacuated two Lebanese and three Syrian sailors.

64.title: Malaysia to reopen its borders from April 1 with quarantine waiver
64.article_body: Malaysia is set to fully reopen its borders from April 1 and allow quarantine-free entry to vaccinated visitors, PM Ismail Sabri Yaakob said on Tuesday. Visitors will, however, need to take an RT-PCR test two days before departure and a rapid antigen test after arrival in the country. Additionally, Malaysian nationals will be able to resume international travel.

65.title: India to resume regular international flights from March 27 after 2 years
65.article_body: The Centre has decided to resume scheduled commercial international passenger flights to and from India from March 27 after two years. "International operations shall be subject to strict adherence to Ministry of Health guidelines for international travel," the Civil Aviation Ministry said on Tuesday. The restrictions were in place due to coronavirus pandemic.

66.title: 2 million people have fled Ukraine since start of Russian invasion: UN
66.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi on Tuesday said that two million people have fled Ukraine since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. It represents the fastest-growing refugee crisis in Europe since World War II. Grandi warned that a second wave of refugees from Ukraine is likely to be more vulnerable than the first wave.

67.title: Australia-Pakistan score 1,187 runs for 14 wickets, use 16 bowlers as Test ends in a draw
67.article_body: Australia and Pakistan aggregated 1,187 runs in the first Test in Rawalpindi which witnessed 16 bowlers being used across the five days. The match witnessed four hundreds and four fifties, with Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq slamming two hundreds in the match. The match was Australia's first in Pakistan after 24 years.

68.title: Norway wealth fund puts Adani Ports, 2 others on its watch list
68.article_body: Norway's sovereign wealth fund has put Adani Ports, Canada's Bombardier and South Korea's Hyundai Glovis on its watch list for possible exclusion from investment due to ethical concerns. It said Adani Ports has been put on the watch list for its possible contribution to "serious violations" of human rights because of its involvement in building a port terminal in Myanmar.

69.title: Working hours of Mumbai women police personnel reduced to 8 hours
69.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, the newly-appointed Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey has ordered that women police personnel will be getting eight-hour shifts from Tuesday. The officials reportedly said the new shorter duty time for women personnel will be in force till further orders. The directive aims to help women personnel maintain a healthy work-home balance, they said.

70.title: Putin is a spent force in the world: UK Defence Secretary
70.article_body: British Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is "a spent force in the world" whatever happens in Ukraine. "This will be Putin's end," Wallace added. "No one will be taking his phone calls in the long term. He has exhausted his army...He's reducing his economy to zero...he has to take responsibility for that," Wallace further said.

71.title: Zelenskyy recalls Ukrainian peacekeepers from UN missions to fight Russia
71.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has signed a decree recalling Ukrainian peacekeepers, along with their weapons and hardware, participating in UN missions to assist in the war effort. The move is aimed at strengthening Ukrainian Army against Russian aggression, Deputy Head of Ukrainian President's Office Andrii Sybiha said, publishing the order. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

72.title: Fire breaks out at scrap godown in Thane, no injuries reported
72.article_body: Fire department officials confirmed that a fire broke out at a scrap godown located near the HP petrol pump on the Shilphata-Mahape road in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. While no casualties or injuries have been reported so far, fire tenders were immediately rushed to the spot to control the fire.

73.title: Shell to stop buying oil, gas from Russia, apologises for buying cargo after invasion
73.article_body: British oil giant Shell has announced that it will stop purchasing Russian oil and gas, with CEO Ben van Beurden apologising for buying a cargo of Russian crude oil after Ukraine invasion. "As an immediate first step, we will stop all spot purchases of Russian crude oil, shut service stations, aviation fuels and lubricants operations in Russia," Shell said.

74.title: All sanction options against Russia being considered: Netherlands
74.article_body: Netherlands Foreign Minister Wopke Hoekstra said on Tuesday that all sanction options against Russia are under consideration, including those on Russian energy. Hoekstra added, however, all EU nations should be able to "bear the burden" if they're imposed. EU buys 45% of its gas, around one-third of its oil and nearly half of its coal from Russia, Reuters reported.

75.title: Ashwin is much more difficult to face than Harbhajan: Gautam Gambhir
75.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the off-spinner who is more difficult to face between Ravichandran Ashwin and Harbhajan Singh, Gautam Gambhir named Ashwin as he is "far more" accurate and tough because of his speed variations. "As a batter, I would hate to face Ashwin," said Gambhir. "Harbhajan was more beautiful to watch," stated the former Indian cricketer.

76.title: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy to address British parliament
76.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday will virtually address the British parliament. It will be the first time a foreign president addresses the House of Commons. "Every parliamentarian wants to hear directly from the president, who will be speaking to us live from Ukraine, so this is an important opportunity for the House," Speaker Sir Lindsay Hoyle said.

77.title: President Kovind confers 'Nari Shakti Puraskar' on 29 women
77.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind conferred the 'Nari Shakti Puraskar' on 29 women for 2020 and 2021, on International Women's Day on Tuesday. An initiative of Women and Child Development Ministry, the award recognises exceptional work towards women's empowerment. Social entrepreneur Anita Gupta, tribal activist Ushaben Dineshbhai Vasava and innovator Nasira Akhter, among others, were the latest awardees.

78.title: Raghavan is among the best filmmakers of Hindi cinema today: Sanjay
78.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor said that he is looking forward to working under filmmaker Sriram Raghavan's vision in the film 'Merry Christmas'. "Raghavan is one of the best filmmakers of Hindi cinema today," Sanjay added. The film also features Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi. "I have been in awe of his style of storytelling ever since I saw 'Badlapur'," Sanjay stated.

79.title: There's lot of diverse content across Hollywood today: Kal Penn
79.article_body: Actor Kal Penn stated there's a lot of diverse content in Hollywood currently than there was a decade ago "More great projects with...interesting, funny...diverse stories [are there] for audiences to enjoy, like 'Hot Mess Holiday'," he added. When asked about working in Bollywood, Penn said, "I'm trying to produce more in Bollywood, there's an exciting opportunity with the OTT platforms."

80.title: Clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency: FM
80.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government sees "clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency". She added that the digital rupee is a conscious call taken in consultation with RBI and that the government expects the digital currency to come out from RBI this year itself. "I see a possibility for revenue in [digital currency]," she said.

81.title: 4 dead, 2 injured after car collides with truck in UP's Kanpur
81.article_body: Four people were killed and two others were seriously injured after a car collided with a truck in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur district, police said. The incident occurred on Monday night when the car driver tried to overtake a vehicle but collided with the speeding truck coming from the opposite direction. The car was going towards Ghatampur, police said.

82.title: Apple's Russia exit may cost $3 mn/day in iPhone sales: Report
82.article_body: Apple might lose at least $3 million in iPhone sales revenue daily or $1.14 billion annually as it announced to pull out from the Russian market, Lithuania-based online shopping portal Burga reported. Apple accounts for 15% of the Russian smartphone sales to rank third overall. South Korea's Samsung occupies the top position with 34%.

83.title: Kumble would've taken over 1,000 int'l wickets with DRS: Kohli's coach
83.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said Anil Kumble would have taken more than 1,000 wickets in international cricket if he had DRS, having retired with 956 wickets. "During my time..., if the ball struck the pads of the batter while...on the front foot, the umpire would...give it not out," added Rajkumar. Kumble is India's top wicket-taker in Tests.

84.title: School uniforms worth ₹351 cr distributed to students during COVID in MP
84.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government distributed school uniforms worth ₹351 crore to over 1.17 crore students across 50 districts of the state during COVID-19 pandemic in financial year 2020-21, School Education Minister Inder Singh Parmar said. While "radio school" (online) was started for Classes 1 to 8, students from Classes 9 to 12 studied under "Hamara Ghar Hamara Vidyalaya" plan, he added.

85.title: To say that govt controlled oil prices due to polls is incorrect: Puri
85.article_body: Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday said oil prices are determined by global prices and "to say that the government had controlled oil prices due to elections is not correct". "We'll take decisions in the best interest of our citizens," he added. This comes after global oil prices reached close to the $140/barrel mark on Monday.

86.title: IMD issues yellow alert in parts of Maharashtra, Gujarat & MP
86.article_body: The IMD issued a yellow alert for Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat and Maharashtra forecasting thunderstorms for the next two days. The wind confluence and a trough in easterlies run from the southeast Arabian Sea off Kerala coast to Konkan coast in lower tropospheric levels and these conditions are likely to bring thunderstorms and rains in these states, the weather agency said.

87.title: Raipur journalist held for political satire now charged with prostitution
87.article_body: Nilesh Sharma, a journalist who was earlier arrested by Raipur Police for allegedly writing satirical articles on Congress MLAs, has now been charged with three new sections. According to the police, they have found pornographic content in Sharma's phone and have sent him to jail charging him with sections under the IT Act and prevention of immoral trafficking law.

88.title: Dish TV to move SAT against SEBI order to disclose its AGM voting results
88.article_body: Dish TV on Tuesday said it will move the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) against SEBI's interim order directing Dish TV to disclose its annual general meeting's (AGM) voting results. SEBI had ordered Dish TV on Monday to disclose AGM results within 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and directed depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors.

89.title: How will the new UPI work on feature phones and in offline mode?
89.article_body: To use RBI's UPI123Pay, users need to link their bank account with their feature phones and set up a UPI pin with a debit card. They can call an Interactive Voice Response number to transfer money. They can also use a missed call payment feature to send money to a merchant/shop or tap their phones on a sound-based payments device.

90.title: 15th round of India and China military talks on March 11: Reports
90.article_body: India and China will hold the 15th round of Corps Commander-level talks on March 11, reports claimed on Tuesday. The talks will be held at the Chushul Moldo meeting point in India. The 14 rounds of talks held so far have led to a resolution in the North and South Bank of Pangong Tso, Galwan and Gogra Hot Spring areas.

91.title: Bye bye, good riddance: Simon Jordan on Chelsea's Russian owner Abramovich
91.article_body: Terming Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich as one of the "worst things" for English football, ex-Crystal Palace owner Simon Jordan said, "[Abramovich's legacy] is awful...good riddance, bye bye." "He's part of a regime that's got a Mafioso boss that's gone mad...in Vladimir Putin," added Jordan. Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss had earlier called Abramovich one of Putin's closest friends.

92.title: Swiggy hires JP Morgan, I-Sec for $800 mn-$1 billion IPO: Reports
92.article_body: Swiggy has hired two investment banks JP Morgan and ICICI Securities for the launch of its $800 million to $1 billion IPO, media reports said citing sources. Swiggy plans to offer about 10% stake in the IPO, which may be a mix of primary and secondary offering. It may file the DRHP with SEBI by June.

93.title: Bengaluru Police detects 7 cases of house break-ins & thefts
93.article_body: DCP (Bengaluru's Whitefield) S Girish took to Twitter on Monday and informed that Bellandur Police detected seven "important" cases of house break-ins and thefts in the city. Girish tweeted that the Bellandur Police was rewarded with appreciation certificates over the same. He also informed that the police recovered 500 grams of gold jewellery from the possession of an offender.

94.title: Income Tax raids premises linked to Aaditya Thackeray's aide
94.article_body: The Income Tax department carried out searches on premises linked to Shiv Sena leader Rrahul Narain Kanal, who is a close aide of Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray. The raid was conducted in connection with alleged tax evasion by BMC Standing Committee's Chairman Yashwant Jadhav. Kanal is a member of BMC's Education Committee and trustee of Shri Sai Baba Sansthan Trust.

95.title: 694 Indian students stuck in Ukraine's Sumy being evacuated: Govt
95.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has confirmed that the evacuation process for Indian students stranded in Ukraine's Sumy city has started. The minister said, "Last night, I checked with the control room, 694 Indian students were remaining in Sumy. Today, they have all left in buses for Poltava." This comes after Russia announced ceasefire in five cities including Sumy.

96.title: For privilege we have, my father works hard every day: Big B's daughter Shweta
96.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan's daughter Shweta Nanda said that being in public eye is not easy. "For all privilege we have, my father, who will turn 80 this year, works hard every day...I have seen what goes behind everything. He wakes up at 5...is on the set, which is a tough world...Then you are picked on for every thing," she added.

97.title: Not going to play Tests again, so no point in playing first-class cricket: Finch
97.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch, who last played a first-class match in 2019, has said he doesn't see any point in playing Sheffield Shield cricket again as he's not going to play Test cricket anymore. "Unless you're pushing for a Test match, I don't really see the point," he stated. Finch last played a Test match in December 2018.

98.title: Ukraine’s youngest MP aged 26 takes up arms to fight Russia; posts pics with AK-47
98.article_body: Amid the war in the country, Ukraine's youngest Member of Parliament Sviatoslav Yurash has taken up arms to fight Russia. The 26-year-old has been posting pictures of him with an AK-47 assault rifle looped over one shoulder. "This is defining moment for our nation. We either fight and survive, to live on to next generation, or we fall," he said.

99.title: Wheelchair-bound B'luru professor accuses Air India of denying boarding
99.article_body: A wheelchair-bound professor at Bengaluru's Indian Statistical Institute has alleged that he was "humiliated" and denied boarding an Air India flight at Bengaluru airport on Monday. The professor, Kaushik Kumar Majumdar, alleged the Kolkata-bound flight's pilot asked him to remove his wheelchair battery. However, he told the pilot that it was "impossible," following this, he was denied boarding.

100.title: I went through a tough time after my father's death: Fardeen on Feroz Khan
100.article_body: Speaking about what kept him away from films for over a decade, actor Fardeen said he was going through a tough time after his father, actor Feroz Khan's death due to lung cancer in 2009. "I needed some time off...I had a little bit of a health scare myself in 2009 just a few months after his death," he added.

101.title: Co-star got scared, I can't remember: Bob on heart attack on 'Better...' set
101.article_body: American actor Bob Odenkirk who suffered heart attack on sets of 'Better Call Saul' in July last year said he does not remember anything about it. "She [co-star Rhea Seehorn] got scared, I wasn't scared...Can't help but think about it fair amount," Odenkirk said, adding, "Reaction I got from public and friends, it all affected me...it still will...and continues to."

102.title: Central agencies have become BJP's publicity machinery: Aaditya Thackeray
102.article_body: Reacting to the Income Tax department raids on premises of MVA leaders, Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that the central probe agencies have in a way become "publicity machinery" of BJP. "Maharashtra in the past has witnessed invasion. This is an invasion by Delhi," he added. "Maharashtra will not be scared nor will it bow down," Thackeray further said.

103.title: Ukraine starts evacuating civilians from Sumy, video shows people inside buses
103.article_body: Ukraine has begun evacuating civilians from Sumy as Russia opened humanitarian corridors. "We call on Russia to uphold...ceasefire commitment, to refrain from activities that endanger the lives of people and to allow the delivery of humanitarian aid," wrote Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs. "We call on Russia to agree on other humanitarian corridors," it tweeted while sharing a video.

104.title: SP candidate keeps vigil on strong room in Meerut through binoculars
104.article_body:
SP candidate from Hastinapur constituency in Meerut district, Yogesh Verma, has been 
camping outside the vote counting site at the Agriculture University in Meerut and is keeping an eye on EVM strong room with binoculars to prevent "mishandling". "SP chief has ordered to keep an eye on EVM strong room...We will work in three shifts of eight hours," Verma said.

105.title: Warne brought spin as attacking commodity to cricketing world: Ashwin
105.article_body: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said that Shane Warne, who passed away last week, brought spin as an attacking commodity to the cricketing world. "He was a colourful character, he redefined bowling, took more than 1000 international wickets," added Ashwin on his YouTube channel. He further said, "Warne was a maestro...lived his life to the fullest."

106.title: BJP will be ousted the day people find a viable alternative: Mamata
106.article_body: West Bengal CM and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said the BJP will be ousted from power the day people find an alternative. Speaking at TMC's organisational meet, Banerjee said opposition parties should come together to form the alternative force needed to oust BJP from power. TMC is supporting BJP rival Samajwadi Party in the ongoing UP Assembly polls.

107.title: NASA's Curiosity rover captures photo of tiny mineral flower on Mars
107.article_body: NASA shared a close-up picture of a tiny, flower-like mineral deposit on the surface of Mars captured by Curiosity rover. "It's a concretion, eroded from sedimentary rock that was cemented by mineral-rich groundwater," the rover's Twitter handle informed. The centimetre wide branching rock resembles a sponge or coral but is lifeless. It was likely formed when water still covered Mars.

108.title: Police create green corridor for transportation of live organs in Hyd
108.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Traffic Police created a green corridor for the transportation of a live heart and lungs from Kamineni Hospital in LB Nagar to KIMS Hospital in Begumpet. The ambulance covered 17.6 kilometres within 16 minutes without traffic obstructions, police said. "Ambulance started from Kamineni Hospital at 10.01 hours and reached KIMS Hospital at 10.17 hours," police added.

109.title: Sure that people have voted against arrogant govt: Cong's Hooda on exit poll
109.article_body: Reacting to the exit poll results of Assembly elections, Congress leader Deepender Hooda said, the party is sure that people have voted against the arrogant (central) government in all five states. "Congress will form government on its own in Uttarakhand, Punjab, Manipur and Goa. There'll be a change in UP and government will be formed with Congress' support," he added.

110.title: You'll always be my Hero: Rajkummar on his mother's 6th death anniversary
110.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao shared a post remembering his mother on her 6th death anniversary. Sharing a picture from his wedding with Patralekhaa, Rajkummar can be seen blowing a kiss to his mother's photo frame, he captioned it, "It's been six years Maa, since you left us but I know you are always there with me...You will always be my Hero."

111.title: May seek exception to EU sanctions on Russian gas & oil: Bulgaria PM
111.article_body: Bulgaria is supportive of EU sanctions on Russia but may seek an exception if they're imposed on Russian natural gas and oil supply, PM Kiril Petkov said on Monday. "We don't have...alternatives [for gas and oil imports] right now, we're too dependent," Petkov added. Over 60% of the fuel used in Bulgaria is reportedly produced by a Russia-owned oil refinery.

112.title: Intel's self-driving car unit Mobileye confidentially files for US IPO
112.article_body: Intel's self-driving car unit Mobileye confidentially filed for an initial public offering in the United States on Monday. The number of shares to be offered and the price range for the proposed offering have not yet been determined, Intel said. The chipmaker had originally purchased Israel-based company Mobileye in 2017 for $15.3 billion.

113.title: Puneeth's last movie 'James' to hit 4,000 screens on his birth anniversary
113.article_body: Late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar's last film 'James' will be released in as many as 4,000 screens across India on his birth anniversary on March 17. The film will be released in Tamil, Hindi, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam languages. Puneeth is playing the role of a manager in a security company in the movie.

114.title: Cyberabad Traffic Police posts video of woman hit by 2-wheeler
114.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police shared a video of a road accident in Moinabad X road. In the video, a speeding two-wheeler can be seen hitting a woman who was crossing the road. "Taking your eyes off the road for two seconds is a big deal!" the Cyberabad Traffic Police captioned the video.

115.title: Who is Inspector Madhulatha, the 1st woman SHO appointed in Hyd?
115.article_body: Inspector K Madhulatha took charge as the station house officer of Hyderabad's Lallaguda Police Station on International Women's Day on Tuesday. The 2002-batch officer is the first woman officer to lead a law and order police station in Hyderabad. The 42-year-old was also the first woman officer to head the IT Corridor Women Police Station in the city.

116.title: Delhi Police dedicates Defence Colony station to women to mark Women's Day
116.article_body: Delhi Police dedicated the Defence Colony Police Station to women officers on Tuesday to mark International Women's Day. "Whether it's a case, whether it's a call, whether it's a complainant, lady staff will handle it today," DCP South Benita Mary Jaikar said. All ranks right from the SHO to the division and patrolling staff will be women, she added.

117.title: TN minister's daughter seeks B'luru Police's protection for self, husband
117.article_body: Jayakalyani, the daughter of Tamil Nadu minister and DMK leader PK Sekar Babu, has sought protection from Bengaluru Police for herself and her husband Satish Kumar. She alleged her family is against their relationship and had got Satish arrested earlier when they tried getting married. "I suspect...my father [is] behind this," she said, adding that they got death threats too.

118.title: Kohli played 2011 WC semi against Pakistan despite neck and jaw pain: Ex-India physio
118.article_body: Former Team India physio Ashish Kaushik has revealed that Virat Kohli played the 2011 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan in Mohali despite neck and jaw pain. Kaushik added, "Kohli would take everything extremely lightly and somehow know...he can work through it." "His pain tolerance is phenomenal...Kohli has got a tremendous ability to endure pain and look for solutions," he stated.

119.title: M&A in their early days: Harsh Goenka as he shares childhood pic of Ambani brothers
119.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka has shared a childhood photograph of Mukesh Ambani and Anil Ambani on Twitter and wrote, "Two brothers in their early days...M&A." The picture shows the two brothers dressed in formal suits with garlands around their necks. "Mukesh Ambani's looks are always constant," a Twitter user reacted to the picture.

120.title: Dog peed right by me as I celebrated Best Actor award win: Nakuul
120.article_body: Nakuul Mehta, who bagged the Best Actor-Television award for his show 'Bade Achhe Lagte Hain 2', at the Indian Television Awards 2022, said he celebrated his win by having kathi roll on the streets of Mumbai. "Whilst a passing stray dog, peed right by me. Gentle reminder by...universe that...the world may still not give a shit about you," he added.

121.title: Edtech unicorn Emeritus raises $350 million from CPP Investments
121.article_body: Edtech unicorn Emeritus has raised $350 million in debt financing from Canada Pension Plan Investment Board through its subsidiary CPPIB Credit Investments. After the funding's completion, Emeritus claims that it will have raised more than $1 billion in debt and equity. CPP Investments also participated in Emeritus' $650 million funding last year, which pushed Emeritus' valuation to $3.2 billion.

122.title: 70-year-old man found dead at home in UP's Greater Noida
122.article_body: A 70-year-old man was found dead at his home in Habibpur village in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida on Monday morning, police said. "Prima facie it appears that the man was strangulated. However, a post mortem report will confirm the cause of death," police added. The victim was involved in a property dispute with some relatives, police further said.

123.title: David Warner does bhangra on field during match against Pakistan, video goes viral
123.article_body: A video of Australia opener David Warner doing bhangra on the field during first Test against Pakistan in Rawalpindi has gone viral. "The crowd and the camera love Warner," the official account of Pakistan Cricket tweeted sharing the video. "Some entertainment in boring dead Test match," a fan commented on the video.

124.title: Unbelievably moved: Kristen Stewart on her 1st Oscar nomination
124.article_body: Actress Kristen Stewart has said that she was unbelievably moved after receiving an Oscar nomination for her film 'Spencer'. "I am truly astounded and unbelievably moved and touched and just stunned," she stated. Kristen has been nominated in the Best Actress category for her role as Princess Diana in the film. Kristen added that she loved the film.

125.title: Pune Metro trains to get dedicated ladies' coach 'Nari Shakti'
125.article_body: Pune Metro will soon run three-coach trains with a dedicated ladies' compartment called 'Nari Shakti', said Hemant Sonawne, Public Relation Officer of Pune Metro. The coaches will be equipped with CCTV cameras, charging sockets, air conditioning and emergency buttons, which will connect a passenger directly to loco pilot and station control room. The fares will be between ₹10-₹20, Sonawne added.

126.title: Delhi's maximum temperature likely to rise up to 34°C over next 6 days
126.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi will see a further rise in the next six days, the India Meteorological Department has said. The temperature is likely to rise up to about 32°C on March 13 and to 34°C by the next day. IMD said that the city is likely to record a high of 30°C on Tuesday.

127.title: Bengaluru bans protests near colleges, schools till March 22 amid hijab row
127.article_body: Amid the ongoing hijab controversy, Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has extended the ban on protests and gatherings within the 200-metre radius of schools, colleges, and other educational institutions till March 22. This is important to maintain public peace and order in Bengaluru, Pant said, adding the issue is still alive. The ban was first imposed on February 9.

128.title: Exit polls tactic to create mental pressure: RLD chief
128.article_body: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) chief Jayant Chaudhary on Tuesday rejected exit poll predictions that said BJP will retain power in Uttar Pradesh. "I do not agree with...exit poll process," he told ANI. "The exit polls are an attempt to create mental pressure. It's a way to demoralise the people who want a change in the state," Chaudhary added.

129.title: Revenue Secy urges Customs officials to be cautious amid rise in drug hauls
129.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Monday urged officials of the Customs department to be cautious amid rise in drug hauls across the country. "The change in the geopolitical situation may actually see that we are getting more quantity than what we were getting earlier," Bajaj said during an investiture ceremony organised by the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs.

130.title: Rapper-YouTuber Lil Bo Weep dies aged 22, father says 'She couldn't fight anymore'
130.article_body: Australian rapper-YouTuber Lil Bo Weep has died aged 22, her father Matthew Schofield confirmed in a Facebook post. "We lost the fight for my daughter's life against depression, trauma, PTSD and drug addiction that we have been fighting since we got her back from America through emergency repatriation DFAT but broken," he wrote. "She could not fight anymore," he added.

131.title: We were all saying Ashwin is struggling, his career is probably over: Sodhi
131.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin becoming India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, ex-India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi said, "We were all saying that Ashwin is struggling, his career is probably over but that's not the case." "Anil Kumble has been my idol, so I'd want...Ashwin doesn't break his record [of 619 Test wickets]," added Reetinder. Ashwin has taken 436 Test wickets.

132.title: Domestic help jumps from 5th floor of building in Bandra, dies
132.article_body: A 30-year-old domestic help, Sarita Toko, jumped to her death from the fifth floor of a building in Mumbai's Bandra on Sunday. Toko hails from Jharkhand and had started working at a flat on the fifth floor last week. Her employers learnt of the incident only after a newspaper delivery person found her body in the compound, police said.

133.title: Nickel price more than doubles in a day, briefly hits $100,000 a tonne
133.article_body: Nickel price jumped as much as 111% on Tuesday to briefly surge above a record $100,000/tonne on London Metal Exchange (LME), before paring some gains. LME halted trading in nickel as brokers faced trouble in paying margin calls following the largest-ever price move on the exchange. This comes amid a rise in risk of shortages from Russia, following Ukraine's invasion.

134.title: Duplantis breaks his own pole vault world record for 2nd time in 2 years
134.article_body: Armand Duplantis of Sweden has set a new pole vault world record of 6.19 metres at the World Athletics Indoor Tour event in Belgrade, Serbia. This is the second time in two years that Duplantis has improved his own record by 1cm. In February 2020, he had broken his own record of 6.17 metres with a 6.18 metres clearance.

135.title: Geeta praises Virat for having Anushka next to him on 100th Test felicitation
135.article_body: Cricketer Harbhajan Singh's wife Geeta Basra spoke about Anushka Sharma being present on the ground when Virat Kohli was felicitated on his 100th Test match. She lauded Virat for having Anushka next to him and said he is changing rules. "It was...first time a cricketer's wife was next to her husband when he was being honoured on field," Geeta said.

136.title: 7 students from Pune district yet to return from Ukraine
136.article_body: Seven more students from Maharashtra's Pune district are yet to return from Ukraine as on Monday as three of them are in Poland, one is in Oman and three students are in transit. As many as 102 students from the district have been brought back. Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh said the administration is in touch with the students.

137.title: Assam man burns wife alive for failing to meet dowry demands; held
137.article_body: A 40-year-old man allegedly burnt his wife alive in Moina in Assam's Karimganj district after her family failed to meet his demands for dowry, police said on Tuesday. The accused, Jamal Uddin, married the victim, Khudeja Begum, after his first wife left him and remarried. Begum used to live with her parents due to Uddin's dowry demands.

138.title: Shortfall of 19,128 classrooms in state-run schools: Gujarat Min
138.article_body: Responding to a set of questions raised by Congress MLAs, Gujarat Education Minister Jitu Vaghani informed the House that there was a shortfall of 19,128 classrooms in various state-run primary schools as of December 2021. The Gujarat government has also built 2,714 new classrooms during the last two years, Vaghani added. Dahod district topped the list of classrooms' shortfall.

139.title: India's economy picking up pace, reflecting reforms of our govt: PM Modi
139.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that India's economy is picking up pace after the COVID-19 pandemic and it is reflecting the fundamentals and reforms of the BJP-led Central government. "By encouraging foreign capital flows, reducing tax on infrastructure investment, creating institutions like NIIF, Gift City, new DFIs, we've tried to accelerate financial and economic growth," PM added.

140.title: Spoke to Warne 2 days before he went to Thailand, we planned to meet: Clarke
140.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke has said he talked to Shane Warne two days before he got on the plane for Thailand, where he died aged 52. "We spoke briefly about trying to get fit...the plan was...I would go and see him, he bought a new car, we both love cars. That's why it was an absolute shock," revealed Clarke.

141.title: Sanctions on India over Russian deal would be extraordinarily foolhardy: US politician
141.article_body: US Senator Ted Cruz responded to reports that Joe Biden-led US administration is contemplating to impose Countering America's Adversaries through Sanctions Act (CAATSA) against India over purchase of S-400 missile system from Russia. "Imposing CAATSA sanctions against India, the largest democracy on Earth...would be extraordinarily foolhardy," he said, adding that India is a critical ally.

142.title: I do therapy once a week, want to tell my younger self to relax: Alia Bhatt
142.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, in recent interview with journalist Barkha Dutt, said she goes to therapy once a week. "I am in the film industry and have been very hard on myself with regards to food and weight. I would tell my 18, 19, 20 year old self 'Just relax, put effort but don't be so hard on yourself'," she added.

143.title: Amazon's Chinese suppliers linked to forced labour camps: Report
143.article_body: Amazon's public list of Chinese suppliers includes five companies previously linked directly or indirectly to forced labour of ethnic minorities from China's Xinjiang region, Tech Transparency Project reported. The suppliers help produce Amazon-branded devices and products sold under house labels like Amazon Basics. Two of the suppliers named in the report were also reportedly used by Apple.

144.title: PMC presents draft budget of ₹8,592 cr, focus on more road networks
144.article_body: Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar on Monday presented the civic body's draft budget of ₹8,592 crore for 2022-23, with a focus on creating more road networks in city. "Despite...Pune Metro being launched, we want to strengthen...public transport...Considering this, I have proposed six more...flyovers...and one bridge,” Kumar said. Many projects will be implemented via PPP model, he added.

145.title: Ashram underpass to be open from March 22: Delhi Deputy CM
145.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday said the Ashram underpass will be opened for the public from March 22 onwards. Sisodia recently also carried out an inspection of the construction site. Another underpass at Pragati Maidan will be ready for use by May while construction of the Ashram flyover will be completed by August, PTI quoted Sisodia as saying.

146.title: Huge rush of passengers on Pune Metro on 2nd day, pics surface
146.article_body: The newly operational Pune Metro witnessed a good turnout on the second day on Monday and a huge rush of people was seen in metro stations. The metro is operational on two routes-- from Garware college to Vanaz station and from Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation to Phugewadi. The facility is open to the public from 8 am to 9 pm.

147.title: Mumbai man jumps in front of train with son over joblessness; child dies
147.article_body: A Mumbai-based 32-year-old man reportedly tried to kill himself along with his three-year-old son by jumping in front of a train on Sunday. However, he survived the jump, but his son died. He was reportedly unemployed and often landed up in an argument with his wife over the same. Following this, he decided to end his life with his son.

148.title: Speeding dumper truck mows down woman on way to church in Mumbai
148.article_body: A 65-year-old woman died after a speeding dumper truck mowed her down in Mumbai's Malad on Sunday. The victim, Aliana Thomas, was on her way to the church when the incident happened. Reportedly, the driver, Mohammad Shafiq Ansari, lost control of the vehicle and hit Thomas who was walking on the roadside. She succumbed to her injuries during the treatment.

149.title: Leonardo DiCaprio donates $10 million for his grandmother's native land Ukraine
149.article_body: Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio has donated $10 million to support Ukraine, which is fighting against Russia. The actor's maternal grandmother, Helene Indenbirken, was born in Odessa as Jelena Stepanovna Smirnova, as per Polish News. In 1917, she emigrated from there with her parents to Germany, where DiCaprio's mother was born.

150.title: Kuldeep Yadav released from India squad for pink-ball Test, Axar Patel returns
150.article_body: Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav has been released from India squad for the pink-ball Test against Sri Lanka scheduled to take place from March 12 in Bengaluru. All-rounder Axar Patel has been added to India squad after being cleared by BCCI's medical team. Axar recently recovered from a shin injury and COVID-19.

151.title: We both went bald: Zerodha Co-founder's wife on their pic amid her chemotherapy
151.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil, who was recently diagnosed with breast cancer and is undergoing chemotherapy, said she decided not to go for a wig as cancer's already a "taboo". "It...didn't feel right...so, we both went bald at the same time. Nithin has agreed to remain bald until my hair grows back again," she wrote, sharing their picture.

152.title: 9 killed after Russian aircraft bombed residential buildings in Sumy: Ukraine
152.article_body: At least nine people, including two children, have been killed after Russian aircraft bombed residential buildings in the Ukrainian city of Sumy on Monday night, Ukraine's State Emergency Service said. Several people have also been injured in the airstrikes in Sumy, which is near the Russian border. Russian aircraft also bombed cities in central Ukraine and destroyed buildings, officials said.

153.title: Pic shows 12-yr-old holding her crying sister while leaving mother behind in Ukraine
153.article_body: A picture showing a 12-year-old girl holding her crying sister as she waves their mother goodbye in Ukraine has surfaced online. "Alexandra, 12, holds her sister Esyea, 6, who cries as she waves at her mother Irina, while members of the Jewish community of Odessa board a bus to flee Russia's invasion of Ukraine, in Odessa, Ukraine," a journalist tweeted.

154.title: Over 75% of Amazon forest struggling to recover from wildfires, droughts: Study
154.article_body: Satellite images collected over the last two decades have found that over 75% of Amazon rainforest are likely struggling to recover from extreme climatic events like droughts, wildfires and logging among others. The study published in Nature Climate Change journal also stated that the rainforest may be nearing a "tipping point" of dieback, where the rainforest will turn to savanna.

155.title: Ukraine claims 12,000 Russian soldiers killed; 128 aircraft, 303 tanks destroyed
155.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday claimed that it has killed around 12,000 Russian soldiers since the Russian invasion began on February 24. Ukraine also claimed that its military has destroyed 303 Russian tanks and over 120 aircraft including 80 helicopters and 48 planes. It also claimed to have destroyed 1,036 armoured personnel carriers, 120 artillery systems and 56 multiple launch rocket systems.

156.title: Ukraine's 'Don't mess with our farmers' video goes viral amid war
156.article_body: A video titled 'Don't mess with Ukrainian farmers' posted by the country on its official Twitter account amid Russian invasion has gone viral. In the video, Ukrainian farmers can be seen towing away Russian defence equipment including tanks with tractors. "Probably it is a bit embarrassing for the 'greatest army of the world' to lose to Ukrainian farmers," Ukraine said.

157.title: Odisha's Ganjam district tops list with highest jobs under MGNREGA
157.article_body: Odisha's Ganjam district topped the list in providing employment under the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA). According to officials, till Monday, over 1 lakh households in the district were provided at least 100-day work in financial year 2021-22. Ganjam was followed by Rajasthan's Barmer and Nagaur, wherein 94,586 and 82,731 households respectively received work.

158.title: Man kills brother, uncle over property dispute in Kerala’s Kottayam; held
158.article_body: A 52-year-old man was arrested on Monday for allegedly killing his younger brother and their uncle during a fight over a family property dispute in Kerala’s Kottayam district, police said. According to the police, trouble surfaced in the family after the accused man got two-and-a-half acres of family property registered under his name.

159.title: Govt will keep focusing on women empowerment: PM Modi on Women's Day
159.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to extend greetings on International Women's Day and said government will keep focusing on women empowerment through its various schemes. "From financial inclusion to social security, quality healthcare to housing, education to entrepreneurship, many efforts have been made to put our Nari Shakti at the forefront of India's development," he tweeted.

160.title: Over 2,600 cases related to sexual assault pending in forensic labs: Maha Min
160.article_body: Responding to a question raised by Pradnya Satav in the Assembly, Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil said that more than 2,600 cases related to sexual assault were pending with the state forensic laboratories. As of January 2022, 1,619 cases related to sexual assault on children and 1,052 cases related to sexual assault on women were pending, the minister informed.

161.title: RBI launches 24/7 helpline 'DigiSaathi' for digital payment queries
161.article_body: The RBI has launched a 24x7 helpline for digital payments queries, DigiSaathi. The initiative will help customers address digital payments queries including cards, and the most relevant and appropriate information will be delivered as soon as possible. RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das also launched an instant payment system "UPI 123PAY" for feature phone users.

162.title: I was the only one in family rooting for a girl right from the start: Aditya
162.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan, who recently welcomed baby girl with wife Shweta Agarwal, has named his daughter Twisha and said he was only one in the family "rooting for a girl from the start". "Twisha is a Sanskrit word. It means 'Rays Of Light'. My father's name Udit, my name Aditya and now my daughter Twisha are all light-related," he added.

163.title: We fought as hard as we could, will wait for results: Priyanka on UP exit polls
163.article_body: As exit polls predicted a return to power for BJP in UP, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Tuesday said that the Congress party will wait for the results. "We fought as hard as we could. We will wait and see the results," Gandhi added. For UP, NewsX and Republic P-Marq exit polls predicted over 200 seats for the BJP.

164.title: Ajay Devgn calls himself Veena's son, Kajol's husband in Women's Day post
164.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Instagram to share a post on occasion of Women's Day on Tuesday. He shared a clip that showed his name being struck out. The clip further reads, "Veena's son, Kavita and Neelam's brother, Kajol's husband, Nysa's father." He captioned the post saying, "Thank you all for shaping me in the most wonderful way."

165.title: India has set a target of net-zero carbon emissions by 2070: PM Modi
165.article_body: Speaking at a webinar on 'Financing for Growth and Aspirational Economy', Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that India has set a target of net-zero carbon emissions by 2070. "To speed up work on this, it's necessary to accelerate environment-friendly projects," he added. "Green Financing...study of such new aspects and implementation is the need of the hour," PM stated.

166.title: Senior al-Qaeda leader killed in overnight raid in Mali: France
166.article_body: French Army on Monday announced that its forces in Mali have killed a senior regional leader of al-Qaeda in an overnight raid on February 25-26. Yahia Djouadi, a former "emir" of Al-Qaeda's Libyan operations, was responsible for finance and logistics for the group in Africa's Sahel region, French Army said, adding, the killing "once again weakens al-Qaeda's governance" in Mali.

167.title: It took so many tears & so much therapy: Anshula on her weight-loss journey
167.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor's sister Anshula Kapoor shared a post on her weight loss journey on Monday. Anshula wrote, "One of my first steps to becoming a healthier me was to acknowledge that mentally I wasn't in the best place. It took so much therapy. So many tears...It's been a two-year-long journey, and I'm still a work in progress."

168.title: Our startups can grow only when we encourage entrepreneurship: PM
168.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that our startups can grow only when we encourage entrepreneurship and focus on new business areas. "The financing sector needs to look at new futuristic ideas, innovative financing of initiatives and sustainable risk management," PM Modi added while addressing a webinar on 'Financing for Growth and Aspirational Economy'.

169.title: Cricket couple Starc, Healy bat simultaneously in respective Aus-Pak matches, fans react
169.article_body: Cricket couple Mitchell Starc and Alyssa Healy were on Tuesday batting simultaneously in their respective Australia-Pakistan matches. While Starc was batting against Pakistan in the first Test in Rawalpindi, Healy was batting against Pakistan in their Women's World Cup match. "What a coincidence," a fan tweeted, while another wrote, "It could be the very first such incident in cricketing history."

170.title: I'm the healthiest person I know & I got breast cancer: Zerodha Co-founder's wife
170.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil has revealed in a blog that she was diagnosed with breast cancer in November 2021 despite being "the healthiest and fittest person" she knew. "The last few months...have been a blur and an emotional roller coaster. As cliché as it may sound, health really is wealth," Patil, who's Zerodha's whole-time director, wrote.

171.title: BJP will seek alliance with MGP if necessary: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
171.article_body: Ahead of the assembly election results, Goa CM Pramod Sawant said BJP is optimistic that it will win more than 22 seats, however, if the party falls short of the number, then it will seek support from the independents and Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party (MGP). "The central BJP leadership is in talks with MGP for a post-poll alliance," Sawant told PTI.

172.title: My dad is in a tough battle: Pele's son Edinho on his fight with cancer
172.article_body: Discussing his father and Brazilian football legend Pele's fight against cancer, Edinho said, "He's in a tough battle...but my father is a fighter, just as he has been his whole life." "We're hoping that he'll recover," said Edinho. Pele is the first man to score 1,000 goals in competitive football having recorded the feat in November 1969.

173.title: RCB to announce their new captain on March 12 at Bengaluru's Church Street
173.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) will announce their new captain on March 12 at an event at Bengaluru's Church Street. "The beginning of a new era of leadership requires a BIG stage," RCB tweeted while announcing the event. RCB are the only team remaining to announce their captain for IPL 2022, which will begin on March 26.

174.title: I have saved 2,305 lives through concerts: 'Laapata' singer Palak Muchhal
