174.article_body: Singer Palak Muchhal who has sung songs like 'Laapata' from 'Ek Tha Tiger' said she has saved 2,305 lives through her concerts which help raise money for heart, kidney patients. "There are still 436 kids in my list waiting to get operated," she added. "Every time I sing a life is saved..., what can be a bigger blessing," stated Palak.

175.title: Info Edge acquires 76% stake in B'luru dating app Aisle for ₹91 cr
175.article_body: Info Edge has announced that it has acquired a 76% stake in dating platform ﻿Aisle﻿ for ₹91 crore. One of early Zomato backers, Info Edge operates platforms like Naukri, Jeevansathi, 99acres, and Shiksha. Post the acquisition, Aisle Founder and CEO Able Joseph will continue to run the company with support from Info Edge's ecosystem.

176.title: A rogue individual is trying to harass me; it is fake news: Sonakshi on warrant
176.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha has said reports claiming that a non-bailable warrant has been issued against her for not attending an event in Delhi after allegedly taking ₹37 lakh in advance are "fake". "This is pure fiction and work of a rogue individual trying to harass me," she added. "This man is trying to extort money from me," she further said.

177.title: Wasn't called on Kapil's show as 'The Kashmir...' has no big star: Vivek
177.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri took to Twitter to say that he and his team were not called on 'The Kapil Sharma Show' because they do not have a commercial star. "I don't get to decide who should be invited on @KapilSharmaK9 show. It's his and his producers' choice whom he wants to invite," he said in another tweet.

178.title: After India, Pakistan lose to Australia in Women's ODI World Cup
178.article_body: Pakistan suffered their second defeat in a row in the ongoing ICC Women's ODI World Cup after losing to Australia on Tuesday. Meg Lanning-led Australia won the toss and opted to bowl, restricting Pakistan to 190/6 in 50 overs. Alyssa Healy then smashed 72 off 79 balls to help her side win the match by seven wickets in 34.4 overs.

179.title: Akshay mourns the loss of his pet dog, says 'You took a part of our hearts'
179.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar and his wife Twinkle Khanna mourned the loss of their pet dog, Cleo, whom they had for 12 years. Sharing a picture with Twinkle and Cleo, Akshay wrote, "They say dogs leave paw prints on our hearts. You took a part of our hearts with you today. Rest well up there, Cleo. Will miss you."

180.title: Do something that makes an Indian uncle go 'Why is she like this?': Richa
180.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha took to Instagram to wish everyone on the occasion of International Women's Day and stated, "Do something with your life that...makes an Indian uncle go 'Why is she like this?'." "Every day is Women's Day," added Richa in her post. "Grateful for your womb and fire of life maa," read an Instagram post from Kangana Ranaut.

181.title: Cong MLA rides horse to Jharkhand Assembly on International Women's Day
181.article_body: Congress MLA Amba Prasad on Tuesday rode a horse to Jharkhand Assembly on the occasion of International Women's Day 2022. "There is Durga, Jhansi ki Rani in every woman...Parents must educate their daughters as women are doing well in every field," she said. Amba also rode a horse to the state Assembly last year on International Women's Day.

182.title: UK PM refuses to ease visa requirements for Ukrainians fleeing war
182.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson has rejected calls for the UK to ease visa requirements for Ukrainian refugees fleeing the war. "We're a...very generous country," but we want to maintain checks on who is arriving in Britain, Johnson added. The British government has been criticised for requiring refugees to first acquire a visa, leaving some Ukrainians stranded in France's Calais city.

183.title: RBI launches UPI for feature phones; transactions won't require internet
183.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has launched a UPI-based payment product for feature phones called UPI123Pay. The product will allow customers to use feature phones for almost all transactions, except scan and pay, and it doesn't need internet connection for transactions. This will help NPCI reach its goal of processing a billion transactions a day, the RBI said.

184.title: Zoe Kravitz recalls losing 'Dark Knight Rises' audition due to skin colour
184.article_body: Actress Zoe Kravitz said that she wanted to audition for a role in Christopher Nolan's film 'The Dark Knight Rises' but was rejected because she was "urban". "Being a woman of colour...being an actor and being told...that I wasn't able to read because of the colour of my skin...and word 'urban' being thrown around...that was really hard," she added.

185.title: Guj man sentenced to death for raping, murdering minor & killing her mother
185.article_body: Surat court on Monday convicted a man of raping and murdering an 11-year-old girl and killing her mother. While he was sentenced to death, his aide was given life sentence till natural death. Police had discovered her body with injury marks in bushes at Sai-fakir garden in Surat on April 6, 2018. Her mother's body was discovered three days later.

186.title: It was fire: Big B as writer Vivek Ranjit praises Abhishek's acting in Sarkar
186.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan reacted after writer Vivek Ranjit praised actor Abhishek Bachchan's performance in the film 'Sarkar'. Vivek Ranjit tweeted a picture of Abhishek from 'Sarkar' and wrote, "Abhishek in #Sarkar is my fav...in that last scene, [he] was pure [fire]...So calm yet fierce." Reacting to it, Amitabh wrote, "I shall absolutely agree with that...it was pure [fire]."

187.title: Woman mistreating aged in-laws has no right to live in their house: Delhi HC
187.article_body: The Delhi High Court has ruled that a woman has no right to live in her in-law's house if she mistreats them. A daughter-in-law can be evicted from the aged in-laws' house as they have the right to live peacefully, the court added. The court's verdict came after a woman approached High Court asking right to accommodation in matrimonial house.

188.title: Body of 21-year-old Indian student to be brought back after shelling stops in Ukraine
188.article_body: Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar has informed Karnataka government that the body of 21-year-old Naveen Shekharappa, who was killed in shelling in Ukraine amid Russian military operations, will be brought to India once shelling stops, said Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai. Bommai added that Naveen's body was embalmed and kept in a mortuary in Ukraine.

189.title: How has Ukraine been able to stop far superior Russian army from advancing?
189.article_body: Experts have said Ukraine has been able to stop far superior Russian army from advancing because of a combination of good preparation, national solidarity and Russian mistakes. Experts added that Russia underestimated Ukrainian forces' home-turf advantage, including knowledge of terrain. Russia also failed to get ground and air forces to work alongside each other, they further said.

190.title: Pak captain Bismah's cradle celebration for daughter after fifty in Women's WC goes viral
190.article_body: Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof's cradle celebration for her six-month-old daughter after scoring fifty against Australia in Women's World Cup has gone viral. "Just second match into her comeback after childbirth and our captain scores a half-century and she dedicates it to her daughter, Fatima," Pakistan Cricket tweeted. Earlier, pictures and videos of Indian team playing with Fatima went viral.

191.title: Credit Suisse cuts India's rating to 'underweight', cites rising crude prices
191.article_body: Credit Suisse has downgraded India's rating to 'underweight' from 'overweight' in the wake of rising crude oil prices, referring to the cut as "tactical". In Asia, India is the "most vulnerable to higher oil prices, along with the Philippines", the agency noted. The downgrade comes as crude oil prices briefly hit a 14-year high on Monday amid the Russia-Ukraine war.

192.title: Over 17,400 Indians evacuated from Ukraine under Op Ganga: Govt
192.article_body: India has brought back over 17,400 citizens from war-torn Ukraine under Operation Ganga so far, the Ministry of Civil Aviation said. Two special civilian flights scheduled from Suceava are expected to bring 400 more Indians back home on March 8, the ministry added. The Government of India started evacuating Indians from Ukraine through special flights on February 22.

193.title: Guardiola and I have pushed each other to insane levels: Liverpool coach Klopp
193.article_body: With Manchester City six points ahead of them at the top of the Premier League standings, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said the competition between the two teams is pushing them both to greatness. "City manager Pep Guardiola and I have pushed each other to insane levels in the last few years," Klopp stated. Liverpool have 63 points from 27 games.

194.title: Lashkar-e-Taiba associate held by security forces in J&K's Baramulla
194.article_body: Security forces on Monday arrested a Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) associate in Baramulla district of Jammu and Kashmir. In a joint operation, the Sopore Police along with 32 Rashtriya Rifles and 92 Battalion CRPF launched a cordon and search operation in the Rafiabad subdivision. Police also seized one AK 56 along with magazine and 30 live rounds from his possession.

195.title: Selling agarbattis to successful salon expert, meet Mita: Urban Company
195.article_body: Urban Company recently captured the inspiring story of Kolkata-based Mita in an episode of UC Impact. A single mother, Mita built her life from selling agarbattis to becoming a successful salon professional today. In the episode, she has shared how she is empowering her daughter, who is studying English Honours, undergoing air hostess training, and plans to pursue LLB.

196.title: Russian oil ban will be catastrophic, prices could hit $300 a barrel: Deputy PM
196.article_body: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak has warned that a ban on Russian oil imports by Western countries "would lead to catastrophic consequences for the global market". "The surge in prices would be unpredictable. It would be $300 per barrel if not more," he added. On Monday, Brent crude price briefly hit $139/barrel for the first time since July 2008.

197.title: Which are now world's 5 most-sanctioned countries as Russia tops list?
197.article_body: According to Castellum.AI, a global sanctions-tracking database, Russia has become the world's most-sanctioned country, with a total of 5,532 sanctions designations. It's followed by Iran, which has faced 3,616 sanctions over a decade, and Syria with 2,608 sanctions. North Korea stands fourth with 2,077 sanctions, while Venezuela stands fifth with 651 sanctions.

198.title: What are the major announcements made in Haryana Budget 2022-23?
198.article_body: In his Budget 2022-23 speech, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday proposed a budget of over ₹1.77 lakh crore. Families whose annual income is ₹1.80 lakh or below will be provided with a free basic health checkup facility once in two years, he said. Khattar announced a school health programme to screen 25 lakh school children twice a year.

199.title: Coinbase blocks 25,000 Russia-linked addresses over illicit activity
199.article_body: Cryptocurrency trading platform Coinbase has blocked over 25,000 wallet addresses related to Russian individuals or entities that it believes to be engaging in illicit activity. The company has shared these addresses with the US government to "support sanctions enforcement". The move comes just days after Coinbase CEO said the firm had no preemptive plans to ban Russian users.

200.title: Women police to head all police stations in TN's Avadi on Women's Day
200.article_body: All police stations under Tamil Nadu's Avadi Commissionerate will be headed by an all-women force on Tuesday to mark International Women's Day. "For the first time in India, all police stations in a Commissionerate will be headed by women. This initiative is to recognise, honour, celebrate and cherish the role of women in our uniformed services," a senior officer said.

201.title: Women are capable of transforming society by their strength: Rahul Gandhi
201.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that women are capable of transforming society by their wisdom, dedication and strength. "They must get their long-pending due. Women's Day greetings to all," Gandhi tweeted. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi will take out an all-female march in Lucknow on the occasion.

202.title: Women are no longer just pretty faces or avenging angels: Madhuri
202.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit said there has been a "tremendous" evolution in the roles written for women, with women no longer viewed as "just pretty faces" or "avenging angels". "Women are viewed as whole people. It is fascinating to see this change," added Madhuri. "We aren't just a part of the story but we are the story," stated actress Neena Gupta.

203.title: Women rooting for each other, that’s true empowerment: Rakul Preet
203.article_body: Talking about women empowerment on the occasion of International Women's Day, actress Rakul Preet Singh said women rooting for each other is "true empowerment" in her opinion. "Women's empowerment...is when all women in some way...support and are genuinely happy with each other's accomplishments," added Rakul Preet. "When a female actor does well, it...pushes me to do...better," she stated.

204.title: Prabhas sent food to every 'Radhe...' team member down with COVID: Pooja
204.article_body: Terming actor Prabhas as very humble despite having a "huge" fanbase, actress Pooja Hegde said Prabhas sent food to every member of their film 'Radhe Shyam' who had tested positive for COVID-19. "My mother also felt happy about this lovely gesture," she added. "Jr NTR is...a perfectionist. His shots get [approved] in a single take," stated Pooja.

205.title: Muslim men allege assault in Gurugram's Sector 45, 2 booked
205.article_body: Two persons have been booked for allegedly assaulting two Muslim men outside a Sector 45 hotel in Gurugram, the police said. The victims were identified as Mohammad Azam, a madrassa teacher and Abdur Rahman, a construction worker. The victims claimed that the suspects assaulted and robbed them of their motorcycle and two mobile phones and fed Azam a "weird" powder.

206.title: Alexander Zverev placed on one-year probation for outburst against umpire
206.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev has been put on probation for a year for smashing his racquet against the umpire's chair in Mexican Open last month. During the probation period, if Zverev receives a code violation that results in a fine for unsportsmanlike conduct, he'll be suspended from ATP events for eight weeks and fined $25,000.

207.title: Test cricket will stop if we don't play Kohli, Rohit: Aakash Chopra
207.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra said Test cricket will stop if Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah do not play in matches, adding that it will "die" being already on the "ventilator". "There is no contest, there is no context, the matches get over in three days," stated Aakash. Team India's Mohali Test against Sri Lanka ended in three days.

208.title: Apple suspends advertising on App Store in Russia
208.article_body: Apple has suspended advertising on its App Store in Russia, barring developers from placing ads in search results. "No new campaigns will be eligible to run on the App Store in Russia for the duration of the suspension," Apple said in an email sent to developers. The decision comes days after the company halted product sales in Russia.

209.title: Success goes to one's head but with Big B it's different: Jhund director
209.article_body: Director Nagraj Manjule spoke about his experience of working with Amitabh Bachchan in 'Jhund'. He said, "I never knew...one day I'd make a film with Bachchan sir." "Despite having done...many movies, he continues to show extreme dedication and passion for the craft. As they say, success goes to one's head, but with Amitabh sir it is different," he added

210.title: Google may buy US firm Mandiant after Microsoft drops out: Report
210.article_body: Google is in talks to buy cybersecurity firm Mandiant, in what would be its second-biggest deal ever, after Microsoft backed out of discussions, Bloomberg reported. Microsoft pulled out of talks more than a week ago on concerns that Mandiant's businesses weren't a good enough strategic fit. The shares of Mandiant rose 16% at the close of trading on Monday.

211.title: Vaishno Devi Shrine Board files FIR against fake chopper booking sites
211.article_body: Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board has filed an FIR with the Jammu and Kashmir Police’s cyber department against fake websites for cheating devotees on the pretext of providing tickets for chopper bookings. "Bookings can be made only on our official website or on phone application, nowhere else," Ramesh Kumar, Shrine Board CEO, said.

212.title: 2 college students in Pune robbed at knifepoint by auto driver, aides
212.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver and his aides allegedly robbed two college students at knifepoint in Pune on Sunday. The students had taken an auto to go to the private bus stand in Sangamwadi, but the driver took them to a public road near the railway gauge in Mangalwar Peth. The duo was then robbed of ₹1000 cash and ₹3,800 via PhonePe.

213.title: Rejected by Indian Army twice over height, 21-year-old student to fight for Ukraine
213.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Sainikhesh Ravichandran, a 21-year-old aerospace engineering student at National Aerospace University in Ukraine's Kharkiv, has taken up arms to fight for Ukraine against Russia. Sainikhesh, who was rejected by Indian Army twice due to his height, has reportedly joined the Georgian National Legion Paramilitary unit. His family said they had asked him to return but he refused.

214.title: CSK sign Ireland's Josh Little as net bowler for IPL 2022
214.article_body: Ireland pacer Josh Little has been roped in as a net bowler by CSK for the upcoming season of IPL. The 22-year-old has played 19 ODIs and 34 T20Is, picking 30 and 31 wickets respectively in the two formats. "Congrats to Josh, who is heading off on a development opportunity with the CSK...experience should be fantastic," said Cricket Ireland.

215.title: Go SpaceX: Kimbal on Russia's 'let US fly to space on broomsticks' remark
215.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk cheered SpaceX on Twitter saying, "Go SpaceX", recting to Russia's "let US fly to space on broomsticks" remark. "I think the United States will be just fine," he added. Earlier, Elon Musk commented on a video of SpaceX launching 47 Starlink satellites into orbit, and said, "American broomstick."

216.title: Alia Bhatt to make her Hollywood debut with 'Heart of Stone'
216.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to confirm that she will make her Hollywood debut with Netflix's international spy thriller 'Heart of Stone'. The movie will also feature 'Wonder Woman' actress Gal Gadot and '50 Shades of Grey' actor Jamie Dornan. The film will be directed by British filmmaker Tom Harper. "Mini Meryl's at it again," Arjun Kapoor commented.

217.title: Ukraine's Air Force shoots down 2 Russian aircraft over Kyiv in quick succession
217.article_body: Ukraine's Air Force has shot down two Russian aircraft over Kyiv in quick succession, The Kyiv Independent said. According to Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine Valerіy Zaluzhny, Air Force hit the first plane of the Russian Federation over Kyiv at 8:30 pm. Another Russian plane was destroyed in the air battle on the city's outskirts at 9:10 pm.

218.title: Statistics of my son having autism are pretty strong: Comedian Amy Schumer
218.article_body: Comedian Amy Schumer said that the statistics of her son having autism are "pretty strong". "He's two and a half and I think they don't diagnose children until maybe six at earliest I think. You can see some signs but diagnosis doesn't come until later...I don't have a preference...You just want your kids to be healthy and happy," she added.

219.title: Pink chowki set up to help sex workers in Delhi's Shraddhanand Marg
219.article_body: Delhi Police have set up a pink police chowki at Shraddhanand Marg to empower the sex workers. "We want to help the sex workers to change profession...for that..we have decided to provide different profession courses," Kiran Sethi from GB Road's pink chowki said. "Our purpose is to provide vocational skills to women to make them employable," DCP Shweta Chauhan said.

220.title: 9 yrs ago, I defended Ukrainians' data from Russia & lost my firm: Telegram Founder
220.article_body: Russia-born Telegram Founder Pavel Durov revealed that nine years ago, when he was Russian social media giant VK's CEO, he defended private data of Ukrainians from the Russian government. "I lost my company and my home. I'd do it again without hesitation," he said amid concerns Telegram could face pressure from Russia. Users' "right to privacy is sacred", he added.

221.title: Man records over 500 naked gym members using camera hidden in coffee cup in US
221.article_body: A US man allegedly used a camera hidden in a coffee cup to film more than 500 people inside gym changing rooms. Peng Dong, 33, was arrested when a member of the Wisconsin Athletic Club found the camera. Dong told investigators that "he was only setting up his video camera to catch the person he believed was stealing his belongings".

222.title: Congress to send observers to states where assembly elections were held
222.article_body: The Congress party said on Monday that it will send observers to all the five states where assembly elections were held. This includes Punjab in-charge Harish Chaudhary and Ajay Maken, who will go to Punjab, while senior leader P Chidambaram and Karnataka Congress unit chief DK Shivakumar will head to Goa. The observers are expected to reach on Tuesday.

223.title: Morari Bapu donates ₹1.25 crore for people in Ukraine
223.article_body: Morari Bapu has taken the initiative of donating ₹1.25 crore as a means to extend help to people affected in Ukraine. Earlier, Morari Bapu's trust raised ₹19 crore for construction of Ayodhya's Ram Mandir, out of which ₹9 crore was donated by foreigners. The trust has now decided to donate ₹1.25 crore from this amount to help people in Ukraine.

224.title: Another aircraft had come in front of my plane, pilot averted head-on collision: Mamata
224.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that another aircraft had come in front of her chartered plane and it was the prompt action of the pilot that averted a head-on collision. "If the situation had continued for 10 more seconds, there would have been a head-on collision," she added. This comes two days after Mamata's chartered flight experienced mid-air turbulence.

225.title: Wait till March 10: Punjab CM Channi on exit poll predictions
225.article_body: With the exit polls predicting a win for AAP in Punjab, CM and Congress leader Charanjit Singh Channi urged the people to wait till March 10, the day when Assembly poll results will be declared. "Only boxes (EVMs) will tell what has to happen. All of you, please wait till March 10," Channi added.

226.title: CCTV footage helps independent candidate reclaim victory in TN civic polls
226.article_body: After a tie with DMK's K Subbulakshmi in Tamil Nadu urban civic polls, independent candidate R Palaniselvi questioned the draw of lots done by the Returning Officer in which Subbulakshmi was declared the winner. Palaniselvi moved the Madras High Court against the Returning Officer. On examining the CCTV footage of the counting process, the bench found Palaniselvi as the winner.

227.title: My mother-in-law dated a man 19 yrs younger than her: Rahul Mahajan
227.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Smart Jodi', contestant Rahul Mahajan said he got married secretly because he never wanted his marriage with his wife Natalya Ilina to end like his previous marriages. After a few pictures from his wedding were shown on the show, Rahul also revealed that his mother-in-law dated a guy who was 19 years younger than her.

228.title: Family said 'you are shy, don't even talk, how will you act': Actress Raashii
228.article_body: Talking about her family's reaction to her taking up acting, 'Rudra...' actress Raashii Khanna said that their first reaction was "you are so shy, you don't even talk, how will you act?" "When the trailer of Rudra came, my mother was...shocked...That's...validation I look for. My parents and my brother never gloss it up...and are my best support," she added.

229.title: Indian student in Ukraine sends pet dog to home in Rohtak with friend
229.article_body: A medical student from India, Sahil, studying in Ukraine, has reportedly sent his pet dog to his home in Rohtak before himself. Sahil sent the dog to India with his friend. He reportedly said that he would only come back to India if his pet dog comes along too. Reports said that the dog is sad without Sahil.

230.title: State govt made several efforts to contain Maoist incidents: Chhattisgarh Guv
230.article_body: Chhattisgarh Governor Anusuiya Uikey said the state government has made several efforts to contain Maoist incidents due to which development activities are reaching every part of the state. "State government's several efforts helped in effectively checking Maoist incidents. On the other hand, success has been achieved in neutralising 46 Maoists and motivating 555 ultras to surrender," Uikey added.

231.title: 5, including 8-month-old boy, charred to death in house fire in Kerala
231.article_body: Five members of a family, including an eight-month-old boy, were charred to death on Tuesday when their house caught fire in Kerala. Police said that neighbours alerted them. Attempts were made to douse the fire. However, it could not be controlled. Bikes parked at the compound of the house were also gutted in the fire.

232.title: Assam approves replacing paper ballots with EVMs in Guwahati civic polls
232.article_body: Assam Cabinet approved Guwahati Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022 for replacing paper ballots with EVMs in Guwahati civic polls. The decision was taken to "ensure transparency and efficiency in elections", CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said. "We took several important decisions pertaining to repealing of obsolete laws, revision of land premium rates...raising loan from NABARD," he tweeted.

233.title: Never easy for a woman to thrive in a world full of judgements: Sushmita
233.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen took to Instagram on the occasion of International Women's Day and stated that it can "never be easy" for a woman to thrive in a world full of judgements. "To teach it mercy, ah," added Sushmita in the post. "Whatever be the journey, it is beautiful to be a woman," the actress stated.

234.title: Require more women in force to tackle protests: K'taka DG
234.article_body: Karnataka DG and IGP Praveen Sood said the state police needs more women in its reserve forces. "We have witnessed...that women are at the forefront of protests in the state. During the hijab controversy, most of the protesters were women," Sood told Hindustan Times. He added, a new women battalion recently announced in the state budget will help ease workload.

235.title: Russia becomes world's most-sanctioned country
235.article_body: Russia has overtaken Iran to become the world's most-sanctioned country, days after its invasion of Ukraine. Since February 22, Russia has been the target of 2,778 new sanctions designations led by the US and European allies, bringing its total to 5,532, as per global database firm Castellum.AI. Iran has confronted 3,616 sanctions against it over the course of a decade.

236.title: Indian among foreigners to fight for Ukraine against Russia, pic surfaces
236.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs took to Facebook to share a picture of some of the foreigners who have volunteered to fight for Ukraine against Russia. "International Legion of Defence of Ukraine is here! A group of volunteers from USA, UK, Sweden, Lithuania, Mexico and India in Kyiv," the ministry wrote.

237.title: Ranbir looks at my childhood pics and says, 'God, you're an alien': Alia
237.article_body: Speaking about her father Mahesh Bhatt calling her a "mystery", actress Alia Bhatt said, "Ranbir says that to me all the time. And this is the first time I've heard my father say it to me." "Even when Ranbir looks at my childhood photos, he says, 'Look at your eyes. God, you're an alien. What are these eyes?'," Alia said.

238.title: 114 held in illegal arms cases in Gujarat Police's special drive in Feb
238.article_body: As many as 106 cases were lodged and 114 persons were arrested for illegal sale, smuggling, purchase, possession and production of firearms and ammunition across Gujarat in a special drive by Gujarat Police in February. The month-long drive, from February 1 to February 28, was conducted across all 33 districts of Gujarat.

239.title: Top Russian Army general killed in Ukraine
239.article_body: A top Russian Army general has been killed in fighting around Kharkiv, Ukrainian intelligence has claimed. Major General Vitaly Gerasimov, chief of staff of the 41st Army, was killed along with other senior officers. Investigative journalism agency Bellingcat said it had confirmed Gerasimov's death with a Russian source.

240.title: Zelenskyy reveals his location on Instagram, says 'I'm not hiding, not afraid of anyone'
240.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday revealed his location in Kyiv on Instagram. He put out a video from his office on Bankova Street in Kyiv, saying, "I'm not hiding. And I'm not afraid of anyone." He added, "You know we used to say, Monday is a hard day. There is war in the country, so every day is Monday."

241.title: BJP will win more seats in final results than predicted in exit polls: U'khand CM
241.article_body: Soon after the exit polls predicted an edge to BJP in the state Assembly polls, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said the party would win more seats in the final results than predicted in the exit polls. "People of Uttarakhand have shown faith in us and will form the government," Dhami added.

242.title: Czech President to award state honour to Ukraine’s Prez Zelenskyy
242.article_body: Czech Republic President Milos Zeman on Monday announced that he would award the highest state honours to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "This is because the Ukrainian President has shown courage and bravery, and although the United States offered him an evacuation, he stayed in the capital of his country, from where he is leading its defence," Zeman said.

243.title: Russia will not send conscript soldiers to fight in Ukraine: Putin
243.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said that he will not send conscript soldiers to fight in Ukraine. "And there will be no additional call-up of reservists," he added in a televised address. "The fixed objectives are only carried out by professional servicemen. I'm sure they are guaranteeing security and peace for the Russian people in an effective manner," Putin further said.

244.title: Avalanche hits Himachal Pradesh's Rohli, roads blocked
244.article_body: An avalanche has hit Rohli (10 km ahead from Tindi towards Killar) in Lahaul and Spiti district of Himachal Pradesh, blocking roads, the State Emergency Operation Centre informed in an official statement. Around five-six vehicles are stuck between Rohli and Kadu Nallah and a police rescue team has already rushed to the spot to help people, the statement further added.

245.title: 28-year-old bodyguard shoots himself dead in Gurugram's Sector 83
245.article_body: A 28-year-old bodyguard, who worked as a personal security officer for clients of a private security agency, allegedly shot himself dead in Gurugram's Sector 83, police said. The victim's body was recovered from a forest area near his house, police added. "Preliminary investigation revealed, he wanted to be in a relationship with a woman...but it didn't work out," police stated.

246.title: Kerala Police seize drugs worth ₹1.5 cr, couple arrested
246.article_body: Kerala Police arrested a couple and seized 1.95 kg of MDMA worth ₹1.5 crore on Monday. According to police, the contraband was wrapped in a cloth and brought from Bengaluru in a bus. The couple, hailing from Muzhappilangad, was arrested from Kannur Plaza junction. Police also seized 67 grams of brown sugar and 7.5 grams of opium from the couple.

247.title: Alia is most talented, want her to play me in my biopic: Barkha Dutt
247.article_body: Journalist Barkha Dutt said that she wants actress Alia Bhatt to play her in her biopic. "I am not saying this because she just has a film out but I am saying this because I really think most talented actor is Alia Bhatt. I mean there's no question...range, the sheer range, the ease with which she plays everything," she added.

248.title: West Indies Tests are opportunity for us to prove a point: Joe Root
248.article_body: England Test captain Joe Root has said the three-Test series against West Indies is an opportunity for them to prove a point after their 0-4 defeat in the Ashes. "We know historically it's not an easy place for England to come and play...so it's something that we're very much looking forward to. It's a big challenge for us," Root stated.

249.title: Delhi's bus fleet crosses 7,000-mark for the first time
249.article_body: The national capital's bus fleet crossed 7,000-mark for the first time on Monday after Delhi's Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot inducted 100 new CNG buses and one electric bus into the city's bus fleet. Gahlot said over 30 lakh people used a public bus every day in February which is the highest daily ridership for Delhi's bus services since pandemic started.

250.title: Why should I hold 2nd position? My time has passed: Kapil Dev as Ashwin breaks his record
250.article_body: After Ravichandran Ashwin overtook him to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests, Kapil Dev said, "It’s a great achievement especially from a guy who didn't get enough opportunities in...recent past." He added, "Had Ashwin got those opportunities...he would've crossed 434 much earlier. I'm happy for him...why should I hold [the second position] from him? My time has passed."

251.title: Ukraine suffers ₹77,000 crore in damage to infrastructure since Russian invasion
251.article_body: Ukraine has suffered about $10 billion (₹77,000 crore) in damage to infrastructure since Russia invaded the country, Infrastructure Minister Oleksander Kubrakov said on Monday. "The majority of damaged structures will be repaired in a year, and the most difficult ones – in two years," he added. Kubrakov further said that Russia is doing "all it can to prevent humanitarian corridors".

252.title: Last picture taken of Shane Warne shared by his friend
252.article_body: Shane Warne's friend Thomas Hall has shared the last photo taken of the late Australian cricket legend. The photo was taken at Thailand's Koh Samui, where Warne was holidaying. "Anybody that knew Shane knew his warmth, caring, his incredible sense of humour...his laugh...twinkle in his eye and that glare from those glowing, unnaturally white teeth," Hall wrote while paying tribute.

253.title: Warren Buffett among world's 5 richest people again as fortune hits $117 billion
253.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett's net worth has grown by over 7% this year to around $117 billion as his company's shares rallied, Bloomberg reported. The 91-year-old is now back among the world's five richest people, after falling to as low as world's 11th richest person in October. World's richest person Elon Musk's wealth has dropped by 15% this year.

254.title: Shane Warne's daughter shares pics & videos with him, says 'This can't be real life'
254.article_body: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's daughter Summer took to Instagram to share pictures and videos with him. She wrote, "It feels like I'm dreaming...waiting for someone to wake me up and tell me...you're okay. This can't be real life." She added, "I took our time for granted dad...I'd do anything to have more time with you on this earth."

255.title: AAP going to be national, natural replacement of Congress: Raghav Chadha
255.article_body: Following exit polls predicting AAP's majority in Punjab Assembly polls, party leader Raghav Chadha said that the party is going to be the national and natural replacement of Congress. "Exit poll results tell us that the people of Punjab have overwhelmingly voted for change...AAP is now the fastest-growing political party," Chadha said.

256.title: Harry Kane scores twice as Tottenham defeat Everton 5-0 in EPL
256.article_body: Harry Kane scored twice as Tottenham Hotspur handed Everton their third straight defeat in the Premier League. Notably, Kane's brace in their 5-0 win has moved him above Arsenal legend Thierry Henry for a sixth place on the all-time Premier League top scorers' list with 176 goals. Tottenham are placed seventh on the points table with 45 points.

257.title: KCR doesn't respect Constitution of India, wants to write his own: BJP MLA
257.article_body: BJP MLA Raghunandan Rao said Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao wants to write his own Constitution of India as the leader does not want to respect the Indian Constitution. His remark came after he and other BJP MLAs Raja Singh and Eatala Rajender were suspended from the Budget session in the Telangana Assembly.

258.title: Won't restrain BJP MLA Vijender Gupta in defamation case: Delhi HC
258.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday refused to restrain BJP MLA Vijender Gupta from posting defamatory content on social media against Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot. "None should be prevented from expressing their opinions...on the government's transaction of business," HC added. The case pertains to the alleged irregularities in the purchase and maintenance of 1,000 low-floor DTC buses.

259.title: India reports 3,993 new COVID-19 cases, 108 deaths in last 24 hours
259.article_body: India has reported 3,993 new COVID-19 cases and 108 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 108 deaths, 49 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 59 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,15,210, and the active cases declined to 49,948.

260.title: 3 youths drown while swimming in reservoir in Pune's Daund
260.article_body: Three youths, aged 20-21, drowned in a water reservoir in Pune's Daund on Sunday, police said. "The probe so far has indicated that the three entered the water reservoir for swimming. But they got drowned," Inspector Vinod Ghuge of Daund Police Station said. The police have recovered the three bodies, and they have been sent to a hospital for post-mortem.

261.title: Free tabs only for students of classes 10-12 for now, clears Haryana govt
261.article_body: Haryana's Education Minister Kanwar Pal said the government will distribute free tablets only to students of classes 10-12 for now. Though they earlier promised to include class 8 and 9 students in the scheme, he said they would be considered later. Pal also said that tenders for tablets worth ₹620 crore have already been issued by the government.

262.title: ₹3,866 cr set aside to treat sewage in Hyd in T'gana Budget 2022-23
262.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister Harish Rao Thanneeru on Monday presented the state Budget 2022-23. Of the total ₹2,56,958 crore proposed expenditure, ₹3,866 crore will be used to treat sewage in Hyderabad. ₹1,542 crore will be spent towards the maintenance of roads in Hyderabad, Rao added. The government has set aside ₹725 crore for 'Sunkishala' drinking water project, he stated.

263.title: Troll says even Abhishek can't believe when he's offered a film, actor reacts
263.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan replied to a Twitter user who tried to troll him. The user shared a meme and took a veiled dig on the actor's career, it read, "When Abhishek gets...call from any director for a movie. You're not making a fool of me right?" Abhishek wrote with sarcasm, "Hey man! Loved your bio. 'Whatever you are...Be a good one'."

264.title: Man locks, kills wife in bathroom of rented house in Pune, booked
264.article_body: Pune Police have booked a man, Sham Dhere, for locking his wife, Ritu Dhere, in the bathroom of their house and killing her in Akurdi on Sunday. Police said that the couple was living in a rented room. Police added that woman's body was found in bathroom that had been locked from outside. Case under Section 302 has been registered.

265.title: Russia declares ceasefire in 5 Ukraine cities including Kyiv for evacuation of civilians
265.article_body: Russia on Tuesday declared a ceasefire amid the ongoing war in Ukraine from 10 am Moscow time (12.30 pm IST) to provide humanitarian corridors for the evacuation of civilians in the cities of Kyiv, Chernihiv, Sumy, Kharkiv and Mariupol, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Russia said. The development comes following the third round of talks between Russia and Ukraine.

266.title: Participation of citizens must to improve air quality: Environment Minister
266.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav stressed the importance of citizens' participation in improving air quality. "Dust management, solid waste management, open waste burning, industrial and vehicular pollution are...key factors that need to be addressed for improving air quality," he said during 'Interactive Dialogue Towards Clean Air' organised by Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM).

267.title: Fire breaks out at fireworks factory in Tamil Nadu, 1 dead
267.article_body: A fire broke out at a fireworks manufacturing unit in Virudhunagar district of Tamil Nadu on Monday. According to the district administration, one person died while another suffered burn injuries in the incident. Earlier, in January this year, four people were killed in a similar fire accident in a firecracker unit in the district.

268.title: MMB floats tender for new jetty, terminal facilities at Mumbai's Radio club
268.article_body: In a move to decongest the existing jetties at the Gateway of India, the Maharashtra Maritime Board floated a tender for the construction of a passenger jetty and terminal facilities at Mumbai's Radio club in Colaba. It is expected to cost ₹80 crore to be completed and the Central and state government will have an equal share in the expenditure.

269.title: Bengaluru sees less than 100 COVID-19 cases; positivity rate at 0.86%
269.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 97 new COVID-19 cases as compared to 146 new cases reported on Sunday, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) data. The city also reported three coronavirus-related deaths in the last 24 hours. The daily COVID-19 positivity rate in Bengaluru dropped to 0.86% as compared to 0.9% reported on Sunday, the data showed.

270.title: Would he want break from IPL? BCB President on Shakib's request for break
270.article_body: After Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan requested pulling out of their upcoming tour of South Africa, stating that he can't play so much international cricket, BCB President Nazmul Hasan questioned Shakib's commitment to the national side. "Would he have said the same thing if he was picked in the IPL?" asked Nazmul. "It's surprising, to be honest," he added.

271.title: Ukrainian soldier proposes to his girlfriend at checkpoint amid war, video goes viral
271.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian soldier proposing to his girlfriend after stopping her at checkpoint amid war with Russia went viral. In the video, the troops can be seen questioning a group of people, who have placed their hands on a car's roof. The soldier gets down on one knee and surprises her with a ring as she turns around.

272.title: Safe corridor for our students in Ukraine's Sumy didn't materialise: India to UNSC
272.article_body: Addressing the UNSC on the humanitarian situation in Ukraine, India's UN Ambassador TS Tirumurti reiterated the urgent demand for the safe and uninterrupted passage for all civilians, including Indians stranded in Ukraine. He said India is deeply concerned that despite its repeated urgings to both Russia and Ukraine, the safe corridor for students stranded in Sumy did not materialise.

273.title: Better.com, that fired 900 staff on Zoom, plans laying off 4,000 this week: Report
273.article_body: Three months after Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 workers on a Zoom call, the US-based mortgage company is planning to lay off around 4,000 people this week, TechCrunch reported citing sources. That is about 50% of its staff of about 8,000. Following the December layoffs, Garg apologised, saying that he "blundered the execution" and took time off.

274.title: Man tries to sodomise 8-yr-old boy in Guj, drowns him in river; held
274.article_body: A man has been arrested for forcibly drowning an eight-year-old boy in Gujarat. "He abducted the victim after luring him with promises of buying a...toy...accused then took the child to banks of Mahisagar river...tried to sodomise him...the child started crying...the accused...forcibly drowned him in the Mahisagar river," police said. Police added that the boy had gone missing on March 2.

275.title: Indian Embassy praises its driver for injured student's 700 km transit in Ukraine
275.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Ukraine has tweeted, "Kudos to Indian Embassy driver who successfully transferred Harjot over 700km from Kyiv to Bodomierz border under dangers of shelling and constraints of fuel shortage, road blocks, detours and traffic jams." Harjot, who sustained bullet injuries in Kyiv, was taken by road so that he can board an evacuation flight to return home.

276.title: Initially people used to say I don't look like a heroine: Madhuri
276.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit spoke about the time when people used to question if she can become a successful actor. Madhuri said, "People used to say that I don't look like a heroine because I was a very young girl from the Maharashtrian root, very petite." "My mother...[used to say] you do good work and you will get recognition," she added.

277.title: 5 held in Pune for kidnapping, threatening to kill youth over loan money
277.article_body: Pune Police arrested five people within four hours after they allegedly kidnapped youth from a petrol pump on Pune-Solapur highway. Police found victim had borrowed ₹20,000 from an accused and had returned ₹15,000. However, accused allegedly demanded ₹1 lakh more, which led to dispute. Accused then kidnapped victim and threatened to kill him if he did not pay ₹1 lakh.

278.title: Sisodia inaugurates health clinics in 20 Delhi government schools
278.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM and Education Minister Manish Sisodia on Monday inaugurated health clinics called Aam Aadmi School Clinics (AASC) in 20 government schools across the national capital. "An extension of the mohalla clinics...AASC will have a psychologist along with the doctor to examine and look over the mental and physical well-being of the students," Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain tweeted.

279.title: Gurugram civic body worker beats salon staff over wife's makeup, suspended
279.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has suspended a junior engineer for allegedly beating, abusing and threatening the staff of a salon in sector 38 on Friday. The man reportedly created ruckus at the salon after his wife expressed disappointment over the makeup done by the staff. Police said the man also left the salon without paying ₹5,000 for service.

280.title: Wanted top Maoist leader Kanchan Da, his aide arrested from Assam
280.article_body: Police have arrested the most wanted and top Maoist leader Kanchan Da and his aide from Assam's Cachar district. The 72-year-old leader was arrested along with Akash Orang from the Patimara tea garden based on information the police had received, ANI reported. A laptop, mobile phone, other devices, Maoist literature and ₹3.60 lakh were recovered from them.

281.title: 4-laning of Mumbai-Goa highway to be completed by May 2023
281.article_body: Four-laning of the Mumbai-Goa highway will be completed by May 2023, said Maharashtra PWD Minister Ashok Chavan. "Over 67% of the widening work on the 11 packages have been completed. However, work on four portions between Indapur-Vadpale, Parshuram Ghat-Adavali, Adavali-Sangameshwar and Sangameshwar-Lanja is stuck," Chavan said. Work on the 471-kilometre-long project had started in 2011.

282.title: SC directs 6 banks to release ₹1,200 cr for stalled Amrapali projects
282.article_body: The Supreme Court has ordered six banks to release ₹1,200 crore before March 14 to aid the National Buildings Constructions Corporation (NBCC) in completing Amrapali's stalled projects. Bank of Baroda, the consortium's lead bank, told SC that it has already infused its share of ₹300 crore. NBCC said it'll also be conducting an independent structural audit of Amrapali's under-construction projects.

283.title: Surveys don't matter, SP will get a majority in UP: Akhilesh
283.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Monday dismissed pre-poll surveys that showed an edge to the BJP in the Uttar Pradesh elections. "Let them show whatever they have got. We are winning with a majority," he said. The SP-led alliance will form the next government in Uttar Pradesh with over 300 seats, Akhilesh claimed.

284.title: TMC 'goons' tried to attack my convoy: West Bengal BJP chief
284.article_body: West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar has claimed some alleged TMC "goons" tried to attack his convoy at Mathurapur in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district on Monday. "TMC still thinks that they can stop BJP by such attacks. I assure them they would fail in their attempts," Sukanta said. "We will not stop," he added.

285.title: Priyanka to lead Cong's all-female march in Lucknow tomorrow
285.article_body: The Congress will take out an all-female march in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow on International Women's Day on Tuesday. Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will lead the march, party's national spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said on Sunday. All women office-bearers of the party and others will take part in it, Supriya said.

286.title: Poor, middle class benefitted from 'Jan Aushadhi Kendras': PM Modi
286.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said the poor and middle class have benefitted from the 'Jan Aushadhi Kendras' set up to provide generic drugs at affordable prices. He also interacted with the beneficiaries and took feedback from them. "These centres are not just government stores but are becoming solution centres for the common man," PM Modi said.

287.title: Sadikali Shihab Thangal chosen as IUML's new Kerala president
287.article_body: Syed Sadikali Shihab Thangal has been chosen as the new Kerala state president of the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML). He has also been named as the chairman of the National Political Advisory Committee of the IUML. The development comes a day after former state president Hyderali Shihab Thangal passed away at the age of 74.

288.title: Free rides on buses, i-buses for Indore women on Women's Day
288.article_body: Women in Madhya Pradesh's Indore will be allowed to travel free of cost in city buses and i-buses on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. Municipal Commissioner Pratibha Pal said that "Atal Indore City Transport Services Limited is providing this gift to women for one day". Concerned officials have been instructed to provide the service to all women.

289.title: Trilogy on Shivaji Maharaj delayed due to pandemic: Nagraj
289.article_body: Filmmaker Nagraj Manjule has said his multilingual trilogy on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj is facing delays due to the COVID-19 pandemic but has not been put on the back burner. "We lost two years...so naturally we could not take it on floors," he said. "Once everything falls into place, you will know," he added.

290.title: Filmmaker Priyadarshan felicitated with honorary doctorate: Report
290.article_body: Filmmaker Priyadarshan was reportedly conferred an honorary doctorate on Monday. He was felicitated by the Hindustan Institute of Technology and Science in Chennai. However, the filmmaker is yet to officially announce this. Priyadarshan last directed Hindi film 'Hungama 2' which premiered on an OTT platform. The film starred Shilpa Shetty and Paresh Rawal in lead roles.

291.title: Woman survives after falling from 5th floor of high-rise in Ujjain
291.article_body: A woman survived after falling from the fifth floor of a high-rise building in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Saturday. Sushmita Yadav had reportedly fallen on a guava tree and was rushed to hospital by some students. Yadav, who is an employee of a private company Profit-mart located in the building, is currently out of danger, according to doctors.

292.title: Women police personnel to manage traffic in MP on Women's Day
292.article_body: Women police personnel will be handling traffic management across Madhya Pradesh along with their male counterparts on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. The initiative is aimed at boosting confidence and self-esteem of women and to convey the message that they can work shoulder-to-shoulder with men, state Home Minister Dr Narottam Mishra said.

293.title: Will be clear on March 10: Cong leader on AAP leading in Punjab
293.article_body: Responding to early exit polls showing Aam Aadmi Party forming the government in Punjab, Congress leader Sunil Jakhar said that the situation will be clear on March 10. As per the ABP C-Voter exit poll, AAP is ahead in Punjab and is projected to get 51-61 seats in the 117-member Assembly. The ruling Congress is projected to get 22-28 seats.

294.title: 'The Kashmir Files' is about right to justice: Vivek Agnihotri
294.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri has said his new film 'The Kashmir Files' is about the right to justice. "They [Pandit community] don't want to speak about their pain, and it's difficult to make them speak their heart out," he said. "We got testimonials from people across the globe," he added. Vivek said he plans to make 'The Delhi Files' after this.

295.title: T'gana to set up 1st women’s university, district medical colleges
295.article_body: The Telangana government on Monday announced the setting up of the first women's university in the state and also said that they will establish a medical college in every district over the next two years. During his budget speech, Finance Minister of Telangana Harish Rao said that the government has initiated measures to introduce English medium in all the schools.

296.title: Never understood the game: Swami Chakrapani on 'Lock Upp' eviction
296.article_body: After his eviction from 'Lock Upp', Swami Chakrapani has said he never quite understood the game. "I am a man who lives in solitude. I have never been put under the same roof along with so many people," he said. "Honestly, it was a surprise to me when I saw people...fighting to be seen," he added.

297.title: 1,314 Indians evacuated today from Ukraine’s neighbouring countries
297.article_body: Over 1,300 Indians were evacuated today from Ukraine's neighbouring countries by seven special civilian flights. Out of the seven flights, four landed in New Delhi, while two reached Mumbai. There were five flights from Budapest and one each from Bucharest and Suceava. More than 17,400 Indians have been brought back since February 22, according to the Ministry of Civil Aviation.

298.title: It's been a sad week: Steve Smith on deaths of Warne, Marsh
298.article_body: Following deaths of Australian cricket legends Rod Marsh and Shane Warne last week, Australia Test vice-captain Steve Smith said it was a "sad week". Warne, aged 52, died due to a suspected heart attack on Friday. Marsh, aged 74, also passed away on same day after suffering a heart attack eight days earlier. "We feel for both...Marsh...Warne family," he added.

299.title: Cong leader holds protest urging KCR to re-install Ambedkar statue
299.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao on Monday staged a protest at the Telangana Martyrs' Memorial to urge the state government to re-install the Bhimrao Ambedkar statue at Panjagutta crossroads. Rao said that CM KCR should install the statue where it was vandalised in 2019. This comes a month after minister KT Rama Rao assured a 125-feet-tall Ambedkar statue in Hyderabad.

300.title: Body of Shane Warne transferred to Bangkok before flight to Australia
300.article_body: The body of Australian spin legend Shane Warne has been transported to Thailand's capital Bangkok before being flown back to Australia. The convoy of ambulance and police drove overnight from Surat Thani province, south of Thailand, to an airport in Bangkok. Warne passed away aged 52 at a villa on the resort island of Koh Samui.

301.title: BJP will return with a full majority in Goa: CM Pramod Sawant
301.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Monday said that BJP will return with a full majority in the state. "BJP will get 18-22 seats...and will form the government. I strongly believe people will once again choose...double engine government," said Sawant. He added that their priority was to complete the infrastructure projects and they'll fulfil the 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat Swayampurna Goa' scheme.

302.title: Medvedev won't be tennis-wise affected by Russia-Ukraine war: Mouratoglou
302.article_body: Serena Williams' coach Patrick Mouratoglou said world number one Daniil Medvedev won't get affected "tennis-wise" by ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. "On a personal or emotional side he might be, but...don't think it's going to affect his level of play," he added. The Russian overtook Novak Djokovic to top ATP rankings for first time in his career last week.

303.title: 4 directors of TN-based firm's held for cheating people of ₹1,100 cr
303.article_body: Four directors of a Tamil Nadu-based firm were arrested by the ED for defrauding people of over ₹1,100 crore. Disc Assets Lead India Limited and Ors collected the money from public in 'Collective Investment Scheme', reportedly promising land or money with higher interest in return. The accused were identified as N Umashankar, N Arun, V Janarthanan and A Saravana Kumar.

304.title: Hundreds attend funeral of 19-yr-old killed in J&K grenade attack
304.article_body: Hundreds of people attended the funeral of 19-year-old Rafiya Jan, who was killed due to a grenade blast in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir, on Sunday. The incident reportedly took place when Jan was shopping with her mother and sister at the Amira Kadal market. The Hazratbal area resident succumbed to her multiple fatal injuries in the SMHS hospital during treatment.

305.title: 501 trees planted in MSRVVP under Ankur Abhiyan in MP's Ujjain
305.article_body: Various institutions' members and volunteers planted 501 saplings under the Ankur Abhiyan at Maharshi Sandipani Rashtriya Vedavidya Pratishthan (MSRVVP) in MP's Ujjain. The programme was inaugurated with the molshree tree, said to cure throat cancer, being planted. The trees were provided by Vasundhara Hariyali Mahotsav committee and would be looked after by gurukul students on a daily basis.

306.title: Dead, benign: Steve Smith on Rawalpindi pitch after 925 runs scored in 4 days of 1st Test
306.article_body: Reacting to 925 runs being scored and just 11 wickets taken after four days in the first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi, Steve Smith called the pitch "pretty benign" and "dead". "I thought it would break up a little bit more and probably turn a bit more from the start, but it probably hasn't done so," he added.

307.title: Want to contribute in every way possible: Sneh on win vs Pak in Women's WC
307.article_body: India all-rounder Sneh Rana, who scored an unbeaten 53 and took 2/27 in her side's 107-run win against Pakistan in 2022 Women's ODI World Cup, said she wants to contribute to the team in every way possible. "Today [on Sunday] I did it somewhere," she added. Sneh and Pooja Vastrakar stitched a 122-run seventh-wicket stand, helping India post 244/7.

308.title: 1 constable injured in IED blast in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
308.article_body: A district force constable was injured in an improvised explosive device (IED) blast in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur on Monday. The constable had accidentally stepped on a pressure IED while removing naxal banners, a police official said, adding, he has been admitted to a hospital and is stable. Last month, four CRPF personnel were injured in an IED blast in Bijapur.

309.title: 2, including a woman, arrested for brandishing pistols online in MP
309.article_body: Two youths, including a woman, were arrested for brandishing pistols on social media in MP's Ujjain. The two people were arrested from Vikramnagar Bridge after the woman, a student, allegedly posted a picture of herself posing with illegal firearms in both hands on Instagram to prove herself as a lady don. Her neighbour was also apprehended for providing her weapons.

310.title: Liquor prices hiked by up to ₹80 at TASMAC shops by Tamil Nadu govt
310.article_body: Tamil Nadu has increased the price of liquor at Tamil Nadu State Marketing Corporation Limited (TASMAC) shops and the hike ranges from a minimum of ₹10 to ₹80. Now, a 180 ml bottle of rum and brandy will cost ₹130 as compared to its earlier price of ₹120. The price of beer per bottle has been increased by ₹10.

311.title: Assam court directs police to register case against CM Himanta
311.article_body: A local court in Guwahati directed the police to book a case against Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma over a Congress MP's complaint. A complaint alleging that the CM made inflammatory remarks over an eviction drive was lodged by Lok Sabha MP Abdul Khaleque. He reportedly approached court after the Dispur Police station didn't register an FIR against Sarma.

312.title: Keep Saturdays free, address grievances of tax assessees: FM to CBDT, CBIC officials
312.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman rapped CBDT and CBIC for allegedly not responding to grievances of tax assessees and directed officials to reserve Saturdays to hold meetings with them. "Are you engaging with your own assessees?...Engage with them and give the clarification required," Sitharaman said. She was having a post-budget interaction with industry members and tax officers in Bengaluru.

313.title: Accounting firms EY, Deloitte sever links with Russia
313.article_body: EY and Deloitte on Monday said they will sever ties with Russia, following two other of the world's Big Four accounting firms KPMG and PwC. EY won't serve any Russian government clients, state-owned enterprises or sanctioned entities, individuals, the firm said. "We'll separate our practice in Russia, Belarus from the global network of member firms," said Deloitte CEO Punit Renjen.

314.title: Airlines urge govt to raise cap on domestic fares citing rising fuel prices
314.article_body: Airlines in India have urged the Civil Aviation Ministry to raise caps on domestic fares citing rising aviation turbine fuel (ATF)  prices. ATF, one of the biggest components of air fares, has risen 26.4% or ₹19,508.25/kl in Delhi since December 15. The Civil Aviation Ministry had temporarily set upper and lower airfare limits in the wake of the pandemic.

315.title: Gavaskar clarifies remark on Warne, says 'That wasn't the time for any comparison'
315.article_body: After facing criticism for comparing Shane Warne with other spinners following the ex-Australian cricketer's death, Sunil Gavaskar has issued clarification. Gavaskar said, "I was asked...whether Warne was the greatest spinner ever and I gave my personal, honest opinion. In hindsight, that question shouldn't have been asked nor should have been answered. That wasn't the time for any comparison."

316.title: Can't behave like a Zara store: Delhi govt defends prohibiting discounts on liquor
316.article_body: Delhi government on Monday defended its decision to discontinue discounts on liquor in the Delhi High Court while mentioning that it was becoming an "export centre" of liquor for states like Haryana and Uttar Pradesh. The advocate representing the government said, "This is alcohol. There's some responsibility and restraint. You can't behave as if it is a Zara store.”

317.title: Govt's duty to evacuate Indians without 'partisan propaganda': Cong
317.article_body: Congress on Monday said that it is the duty of the Centre to make all efforts to evacuate Indian citizens from Ukraine without "partisan propaganda". "We remain gravely concerned about the safety of thousands of Indian students and citizens trapped in war zones," Congress said. Loss of human lives, "mass exodus of people" is unacceptable, Congress further said.

318.title: Foreign Ministers of Ukraine, Russia to meet in Turkey on March 10
318.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and his Ukrainian counterpart, Dmytro Kuleba will hold their first potential talks in Turkey's Antalya on March 10, confirmed Turkish Foreign Minister, Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu. "We especially hope this meeting is an important step towards peace, stability," said Çavuşoğlu. Meanwhile, over 400 civilians were killed in Ukraine since Russian invasion on February 24.

319.title: Russia issues list of nations that commit 'unfriendly' actions, US & UK included
319.article_body: Russia has approved a list of nations and territories that commit "unfriendly" actions against it. These include US, Canada, EU states, UK (including Jersey, Anguilla, British Virgin Islands, Gibraltar), Ukraine, Montenegro, Switzerland, Albania, Andorra, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Monaco, Norway, San Marino, North Macedonia, Japan, South Korea, Australia, Micronesia, New Zealand, Singapore, Taiwan.

320.title: Glamorgan share Viv Richards' pic from his last one-day match to mark his 70th birthday
320.article_body: English county side Glamorgan took to Twitter to share a throwback picture of Viv Richards on occasion of his 70th birthday. In the picture, Richards can be seen sitting on the floor of the dressing room seemingly exhausted after his last one-day match. Viv Richards scored an unbeaten 46 against Kent, helping Glamorgan win the tournament on September 19, 1993.

321.title: 6 workers trapped after roof of coal mine collapses in Telangana
321.article_body: As many as six workers are trapped after the roof of an underground coal mine collapsed in Telangana's Peddapalli district. The roof of the mine collapsed when workers were extracting coal in the Ramagundam region, which is a part of the Adriyala longwall project, the reports said. Security personnel have reached the spot and rescue operations are underway.

322.title: Sandalwood trees stolen from Bhopal railway magistrate's bungalow
322.article_body: Sandalwood trees were reportedly stolen by a group of burglars from the Bhopal railway special magistrate’s bungalow on Monday. The Government Railway Police said that they were informed about unusual sounds from the bungalow at around 3 am following which they arrived at the scene but were unable to find anyone. A case has been registered against unknown persons.

323.title: EU to discuss Ukraine's membership bid soon: European Council chief
323.article_body: European Union (EU) leaders will discuss Ukraine's membership bid in the coming days, European Council chief Charles Michel said on Monday. Notably, Presidents of Lithuania, Latvia, Poland and five other countries have urged expedited EU candidate country status for Ukraine following the Russian invasion. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signed an application to join the EU last month.

324.title: Ukraine's Yastremska to donate Lyon prize money to help her war-torn country
324.article_body: Ukraine's Dayana Yastremska said she would donate her Lyon Open runner-up prize money (€14,545) to her home country to aid efforts following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The world number 103 lost to eighth-seeded Shuai Zhang 6-3, 3-6, 4-6 in final. Yastremska fled Ukraine with her younger sister with help from their parents days after invasion began on February 24.

325.title: I'd sell & buy metal scrap: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal while sharing an old picture
325.article_body: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday tweeted an old picture of him while revealing some details about his earlier days. He wrote, "I rented an 8 ft by 9 ft office in Bhoiwada (metal market) in Kalvadevi where I'd work day-in, day-out." He added, "I would sell and buy metal scrap collected from cable companies, and Bihar, my hometown."

326.title: At least 2 soldiers, 2 UN forces killed in separate attacks in Mali
326.article_body: Malian army and the UN mission in the country said at least two soldiers and two UN peacekeeping forces were killed in separate attacks on Monday. While the soldiers were attacked in the Gao region by militants, an improvised-explosive device (IED) blast hit the convoy of UN mission. This comes as Mali has been fighting Islamist insurgency for decades.

327.title: Never thought I would undergo liposuction: Amy Schumer
327.article_body: Actress-comedian Amy Schumer said she underwent liposuction and added that she never thought she would do anything like that. "Like when I would hear 'liposuction', I was just like, 'that's so crazy to me'," she stated. However, Amy decided to go for the procedure after turning 40 and having a C-section. Amy had also battled endometriosis and underwent surgery.

328.title: Dhanraj Pillay inaugurates astroturf hockey field at INS Shivaji
328.article_body: Former hockey captain Dhanraj Pillay inaugurated the astroturf hockey field at the country's premier marine engineering training institute, INS Shivaji, in Lonavala. Along with Pillay, Navy veteran and hockey coach, Avtar Singh, also inaugurated the astroturf field. Later, a match was played that featured current and former hockey players.

329.title: 'F*** off & go home, Putin', says actress Megan at Spirit Awards; video surfaces
329.article_body: During the Spirit Awards ceremony held on Sunday, host Megan Mullally said, "I think we speak for everyone here when we say we are hoping for a quick and peaceful resolution (in Ukraine)." She added, "Specifically, f*** off and go home, Putin." Her husband and co-host Nick Offerman said, "That is the quick and peaceful resolution we're talking about."

330.title: Poland to set up $1.75 billion fund to help refugees from Ukraine
330.article_body: Poland has approved a draft bill for creating a fund of $1.75 billion to help war refugees from Ukraine. The legislation seeks to allow funding of food, temporary lodging, as well as allowing refugees to legally work there. According to the UN, over 1.7 million people have fled Ukraine following Russian invasion, the majority of whom have arrived in Poland.

331.title: Best employers don't support bloodshed: Ukraine to Amazon Founder Bezos
331.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has written an open letter to Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos urging him to suspend provisions of Amazon Web Services in Russia amid war. "I believe that the best employers...would never support bloodshed and disinformation," Fedorov said. He also wrote that many Ukrainians are working for Amazon globally and they need the company's support today.

332.title: My father said 'Shane Warne can't die, it's Warnie': Brett Lee
332.article_body: Former Australia fast bowler Brett Lee said that he was at his parents' place when he came to know about Shane Warne's demise through former England spinner Graeme Swann. "When I told my dad, he summed it beautifully, he said, 'Warnie can't die. It's Warnie.'" Warne passed away at age of 52 in Thailand.

333.title: They're easy as they're poor: Brazil politician's remarks on Ukrainian women go viral
333.article_body: A Brazil politician's comments on fleeing Ukrainian women, as heard on leaked audio, are going viral. Arthur do Val said, "I’ve never seen anything like it in terms of beautiful girls. The refugee queue…just total goddesses…The queue outside Brazil’s best nightclub...doesn't come close to the refugee queue here. He added, "Let me tell you, they're easy because they're poor."

334.title: MP woman consumes poison after police try to remove encroachment
334.article_body: A woman in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar, who allegedly ran a kiosk on government property, consumed a poisonous substance after police reportedly arrived with JCB machine to remove the encroachment. She was taken to the hospital where she is said to be out of danger. Dhar tehsildar, Vinod Rathore, said the department had earlier issued notice to her following locals' complaints.

335.title: Biggest threat to Test cricket are dead pitches: Jaffer on Rawalpindi Test
335.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has taken a dig at Rawalpindi pitch being used in ongoing first Test between Pakistan and Australia. "Biggest threat to Test cricket are dead pitches. Dead pitch = dead game," he tweeted. Pakistan declared their first innings at 476/4. In reply, Australia have scored 449/7 and trail by 27 runs heading into fifth and final day.

336.title: SL will take time to bridge Test cricket gap between them, India: Gambhir
336.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said it'll take a long time for Sri Lanka to bridge the gap between them and India in Test cricket as India have been dominating. He stated that long time ago there wasn't much difference when India and Sri Lanka used to play in subcontinent. Sri Lanka lost first Test by an innings and 222 runs against India.

337.title: 'Sa Re Ga Ma Pa' host Aditya Narayan quits show after 15 yrs, says 'time flies'
337.article_body: Actor-singer Aditya Narayan has said he will no longer host the singing reality show 'Sa Re Ga Ma Pa', ending his 15-year association with the show. Saying that he was bidding adieu to the show "with a heavy heart", Narayan added, "From an 18-year-old teenager to a young man with a beautiful wife and baby daughter!...Time really does fly."

338.title: Fully grown Snow Leopard spotted in Spiti Valley in rare sighting; ITBP shares video
338.article_body: A fully grown Snow Leopard was spotted by Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) troops in Himachal Pradesh's Spiti Valley at 12,500 feet. Sharing the video of the sighting on Twitter, ITBP's official Twitter handle tweeted, "Rare sight of a rare species." It added, "ITBP is committed to preserve and restore flora and fauna in the Himalayan region."

339.title: 163 Karnataka students still stuck in Ukraine: State govt
339.article_body: The Karnataka government on Monday said 476 students have returned from Ukraine, while at least 163 are still stranded. "On 51 flights under Operation Ganga, 476 students from the state have returned. There are some students who are in Mumbai. Another five to six flights are scheduled today," said Karnataka State Disaster Management Authority Commissioner Manoj Rajan.

340.title: Activision Blizzard sued for wrongful death of female employee
340.article_body: The parents of 32-year-old Activision Blizzard employee Kerri Moynihan are suing the company for her wrongful death. Moynihan was found dead in a hotel room at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel in 2017. Her parents alleged the "hostile, intimidating, offensive, and abusive" workplace she experienced was a "significant factor" that contributed to her suicide, The Washington Post reported.

341.title: Need to check who’s arriving: PM on entry of Ukraine refugees in UK
341.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson on Monday rejected calls to ease visa restrictions on Ukrainians fleeing Russian invasion of their country, citing need to maintain checks on who's arriving in UK. "We're a...generous country. What we want though is control," he said. His remarks come after France accused UK of turning away 150 Ukrainians who wanted to join their families there.

342.title: Bengal Guv physically assaulted by TMC leaders in Assembly: Suvendu
342.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Monday alleged that West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was physically assaulted by TMC leaders on the first day of the Budget Session. "We'll meet Governor. He should take appropriate action against it. If necessary, will consult with [Centre]," Suvendu added. A ruckus erupted in the Assembly after the Opposition protested against violence in municipal polls.

343.title: The Batman was phenomenal, Zoe is Catwoman of dreams: Taylor Swift
343.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, singer Taylor Swift has said that actress Zoe Kravitz, who plays Selina Kyle in 'The Batman', is the Catwoman of dreams. "The Batman was phenomenal," Taylor further wrote. Actor Robert Pattinson portrays the role of Bruce Wayne, who is the Batman in the film. 'The Batman' is directed by Matt Reeves.

344.title: Alliance with SP will depend on circumstances: Priyanka Vadra
344.article_body: Congress National General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has said that an alliance with Samajwadi Party in Uttar Pradesh will depend on circumstances. "We are waiting for the results and will make the decision according to the situation," she said. Speaking about Congress' chances of forming the government in UP, Gandhi said that Congress has "good chances in all the states."

345.title: Robbers escape with cash, jewels worth ₹6 cr from bank in K'taka
345.article_body: Unidentified persons broke into the District Central Cooperative Bank at Murgod in Karnataka and escaped with cash and valuables worth ₹6 crores on Saturday night, the police said. "We are probing the case. There was no forced entry into the bank and the lockers were not broken. They used keys to open it," a police officer said.

346.title: Over 400 civilians killed, 801 injured in Ukraine: UN
346.article_body: Office of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) said 406 civilians were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24 as of Sunday midnight. UN human rights office added that 801 residents were injured in Ukraine so far. However, OHCHR said the real figures might be considerably higher "especially in government-controlled territory and especially in recent days".

347.title: Disclose AGM voting results within 24 hours: SEBI to Dish TV
347.article_body: SEBI has ordered Dish TV to disclose the voting results of its annual general meeting (AGM), held on December 30, in the next 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and ordered depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors and compliance officer. Dish TV didn't disclose AGM voting results citing a pending case in the Bombay HC.

348.title: Empty seats speak loudly: Ukrainian envoy as Russia skips ICJ hearing
348.article_body: Russia on Monday skipped a hearing at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) where Ukraine has appealed for an immediate halt on Moscow's invasion. Ukrainian envoy Anton Korynevych said, "The fact that Russia's seats are empty speaks loudly.
