They are not here in this court of law- they are on a battlefield waging an aggressive war against my country."

349.title: BJP MLAs create ruckus during Governor's address in WB Assembly
349.article_body: BJP MLAs created ruckus during Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar's address in the West Bengal Assembly on Monday over alleged rigging in the civic elections. The incident's video shows them raising 'Jai Shri Ram' and 'Bharat Mata ki Jai' slogans during the Governor's inaugural address to the House. The governor was seen pleading with the MLAs to allow the proceedings to start.

350.title: Over 2.6 lakh Ukrainians escaped to Romania since Russia invaded
350.article_body: The police officials at the Ukraine-Romania border said a total of 2,61,445 Ukrainians have escaped to Romania since Russian invasion of the country on February 24. The officials added the residents entered Romania through its land border checkpoints with Ukraine and Moldova. Reportedly, out of the total citizens who had fled Ukraine, 1,82,312 lakh have already left Romania.

351.title: MP newspaper owner Pyare Miyan gets life imprisonment for raping minors
351.article_body: A court in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Monday sentenced newspaper owner Pyare Miyan to life imprisonment for raping minor girls. The Afkar daily owner, who is aged around 70, was arrested from Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar in July 2020. Police had found some minor girls in an unconscious state on the outskirts of Bhopal, following which he was booked.

352.title: My vulnerabilities are my strength, not weakness: Shruti Haasan
352.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan has said that her vulnerabilities are her strength and not her weakness. Shruti added that women tend to project strength or wear an armour of humour during their vulnerabilities. "You have to wake up and feel stronger than appear stronger than your feeling," she stated. Shruti said she did that to herself for a long period.

353.title: 45th Chennai Book Fair concludes, books worth ₹12 crore sold
353.article_body: The 45th Chennai Book Fair that was being held at YMCA grounds, Nandanam, concluded on Sunday. The 19-day long fair recorded a footfall of 15 lakh people and the sale of books worth ₹12 crore, Booksellers and Publishers Association of South India (BAPASI) said. The fair had 800 stalls, including those set up to promote Tamil Nadu government’s education-at-doorstep scheme.

354.title: Harjot Singh, shot at 4 times in Ukraine, brought back to India; video surfaces
354.article_body: Delhi's Harjot Singh, who was shot at four times in Ukraine's Kyiv, was brought back to India on Monday, onboard an IAF flight. Union Minister VK Singh said that Harjot's condition is stable and that he is referred to RR hospital for treatment. A video showed Harjot being assisted off the aircraft after arriving at the Hindon Airport in Ghaziabad.

355.title: US Airbnb host takes over 2,000 videos & pics of guests having sex via hidden camera
355.article_body: A 54-year-old Airbnb host in the US has been charged for allegedly spying on guests having sex and recording over 2,000 videos and photos for a year. As per the police, a guest found the hidden camera, which was disguised as a power adapter. Meanwhile, his lawyer claimed he was innocent of all the charges.

356.title: UP sees 54.18% voter turnout till 5pm in final phase of Assembly polls
356.article_body: Uttar Pradesh recorded a voter turnout of 54.18% till 5 pm in the seventh and the final phase of the Assembly elections on Monday. PM Narendra Modi's parliamentary seat Varanasi saw 52.79% polling in this period. Fifty-four seats spread across nine districts -- Azamgarh, Mau, Jaunpur, Ghazipur, Chandauli, Varanasi, Mirzapur, Bhadohi and Sonbhadra -- voted on Monday.

357.title: To be part of it is achievement: Boman on pic with Big B, Anupam
357.article_body: Actor Boman Irani on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture with veteran actors Amitabh Bachchan, Anupam Kher and Danny Denzongpa. Boman captioned it, "To be part of this iconic picture is an achievement in itself." The actor further wrote that being a part of the upcoming film 'Uunchai' makes his heart glow with humble pride.

358.title: What we've so far in H'wood is stereotypical: Spider-Man's Zoha Rahman
358.article_body: Actress Zoha Rahman, the first Marvel film character to wear a hijab in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home', has said that what we have seen of South Asian actors in Hollywood is very stereotypical. "Firstly, you don't see more than one South Asian on-screen because it either has to be a South Asian or black or East Asian," the actress added.

359.title: Paytm's market cap falls below ₹50,000 cr as shares hit record low
359.article_body: The market capitalisation of Paytm's parent One97 Communications fell below ₹50,000 crore on Monday as the company's shares hit record low of ₹751. Paytm's market capitalisation stood at ₹48,785 crore as its shares ended 4.15% lower on the NSE on March 7. Paytm made its stock market debut in November 2021 and its shares have declined nearly 65% since then.

360.title: From size zero to size 16, I've enjoyed every phase of life: Kareena
360.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor has said that going from size zero to size 16, she has thoroughly lived and enjoyed every phase of her life. The actress further said that during her pregnancy, she gained 25 kgs of weight but never allowed that to interfere with doing the things that she loves. "I've had...fun being confident in my skin," Kareena added.

361.title: Sachin Bansal's Navi to file for ₹4,000-cr IPO this week: Report
361.article_body: Financial services company Navi Technologies is planning to file draft papers with SEBI for ₹4,000-crore initial public offer (IPO) this week, PTI reported. The issue is expected to open in June and will be a fresh issuance of equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal co-founded Navi with Ankit Agarwal after exiting the e-commerce startup in 2018.

362.title: Yemen's Houthi rebels fire at least 1 missile in Red Sea: US Navy
362.article_body: US Navy on Monday said Yemen's Houthi rebels fired at least one missile in Red Sea on Saturday, March 5. "Although maritime traffic was not impacted, these actions are destabilising and present a danger to all vessels," added the navy. Iran-backed rebel group has fired missiles, bombs in the sea since it seized Yemen's capital Sana'a in 2014.

363.title: China plans to use reusable rockets for manned space missions: Report
363.article_body: China Aerospace Science and Technology (CASC), a state-owned firm plans to use reusable rockets to carry country's new Shenzhou spacecraft for manned missions, reported Space.com. As per the report, the reusable rocket will come in two variants, two-stage for manned missions and three-stage for deep space voyages. Reportedly, tethered landing devices will be deployed during rocket's landing phase.

364.title: Megalodon may have grown to larger sizes in cooler waters: US study
364.article_body: US study revealed Otodus Megalodon, world's largest shark that lived upto 3.6 million years ago may have grown to larger sizes in cooler waters than in warmer areas. "Our findings suggest a previously unrecognised body size pattern following a geography-driven ecological pattern..." said study co-author Kenshu Shimada. Team added the species that lived in cooler areas were 18-20 metres long.

365.title: AAP likely to sweep Punjab, BJP to retain Uttar Pradesh: Exit Polls
365.article_body: Exit polls said AAP will form government in Punjab with India Today-Axis poll predicting 76-90 seats, while News24-Today's Chanakya giving it 89-111 seats. For UP, exit polls predicted a return to power for BJP with NewsX and Republic P-Marq exit polls predicting over 200 seats for the party. Axis poll predicted BJP win in Uttarakhand while CVoter predicted Congress' lead.

366.title: Djokovic contacts Ukrainian tennis player Sergiy to offer help; he shares chat
366.article_body: Novak Djokovic reached out to Ukrainian former world number 31 tennis player Sergiy Stakhovsky and offered financial support and any other help required by him amid the Russia-Ukraine war. Stakhovsky posted a screenshot on Instagram of his conversation with Djokovic via WhatsApp, where Djokovic asked him, "Stako, how are you man?...Thinking of you...hoping all calms down soon."

367.title: Second copyright case filed against Dua Lipa's 'Levitating'
367.article_body: A second copyright lawsuit has been filed against singer Dua Lipa's song 'Levitating' in a Manhattan federal court. Songwriters L Russell Brown and Sandy Linzer accused Dua of copying the opening melody of 'Levitating' from their 1979 song 'Wiggle and Giggle All Night' and 1980 song 'Don Diablo'. Earlier band Artikal Sound System accused her of stealing their 2017 song.

368.title: My career is made up of roles that were rejected by others: Swara
368.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker has said that her filmography is made up of roles that were rejected by other actresses. "In 'Raanjhanaa', I was the last person to be cast because they had a sudden last-minute cancellation," Swara stated. "[In] 'Prem Ratan Dhan Payo', no actress wanted to play actor Salman Khan's sister, so they reached out to me," she added.

369.title: NZ know what's coming up: Devine ahead of Women's WC game vs India
369.article_body: Ahead of upcoming New Zealand-India match in 2022 Women's World Cup, New Zealand captain Sophie Devine said her side knows what's coming up. The match will be played on Thursday. Last month, New Zealand defeated India in a one-off T20I and 4-1 in a five-match ODI series in Queenstown. Earlier today, New Zealand beat Bangladesh by nine wickets.

370.title: Improve laws governing military engagement with nations: China's Xi
370.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Monday told the military to enhance use of laws in their relations with nations. "Improve the laws and regulations governing military engagement with foreign countries," said Xi, who is also the Commander-in-Chief for the country's military forces. The remarks came during a meeting with the representatives of military in parliament.

371.title: I got breast surgery at 15-16, that was very scary: Rakhi Sawant
371.article_body: Actress Rakhi Sawant has said that she underwent breast surgery when she was around 15-16 years old, adding it was very scary. "I was a kid and totally flat...So I [lay] down in an operation theatre and became a cold-to-hot girl," she added. Rakhi further said that at the time she was told it was important to enter Bollywood.

372.title: Squid Game's Lee Jung Jae wins best actor at Independent Spirit Awards
372.article_body: South Korean actor Lee Jung Jae has won the Best Male Performance in a New Scripted Series award at the Independent Spirit Awards 2022 for his role in 'Squid Game'. He had earlier become the first Korean male actor to win the award for Outstanding Performance by an Actor in a Drama Series at the 28th Screen Actors Guild Awards.

373.title: Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth hospitalised after having fever, vertigo
373.article_body: Veteran actor Rajinikanth's daughter Aishwaryaa on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture of her in the hospital along with neurosurgeon Dr Prithika Chary. She wrote, "Life before covid and post covid. Back again in the hospital experiencing fever and vertigo and what not!" Aishwaryaa had tested positive for COVID-19 last month and had to be hospitalised.

374.title: 11-yr-old Ukraine boy with phone number written on hand travels 1,000 km alone
374.article_body: An 11-year-old boy from Ukraine's Zaporizhzhya covered over 1,000 km alone to reach Slovakia amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. With one plastic bag, passport, his mother's note and a phone number written on his hand, he travelled alone because his parents reportedly had to take care of a sick relative in Ukraine. He was supposed to find his relatives in Slovakia.

375.title: Very odd reaction: Benedict on Sam Elliott's 'The Power...' criticism
375.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch has reacted to actor Sam Elliott's criticism of Benedict's film 'The Power of the Dog'. "I'm trying...hard not to say anything about a very odd reaction that happened the other day on a radio podcast," Benedict stated without taking Sam's name. This comes after Sam had called Benedict's film "a piece of s**t" on a podcast.

376.title: Telangana has proved to be India's economic powerhouse: TRS leader
376.article_body: Telangana has proved to be the economic powerhouse of the country, CM K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and TRS leader Kavitha Kalvakuntla said on Monday. "When Telangana was formed in 2014, we had to re-orient and re-invent...state...we started with...budget of ₹1 lakh crore which is today at ₹2.56 lakh crore," she added. We've made tremendous progress across sectors, she further said.

377.title: There were two victims in 'Rust' shooting incident: Alec Baldwin
377.article_body: Actor Alec Baldwin, speaking about the shooting incident on the sets of 'Rust' which killed cinematographer Halyna Hutchins in October last year, said that there were two victims in the incident. Talking about the lawsuits filed over the incident, Baldwin stated, "We have people that are suing people that they think are deep pockets litigants."

378.title: In Indian conditions, he's unstoppable: Jaffer on Ravindra Jadeja
378.article_body: Following Ravindra Jadeja's 175* and 9/87 in India-Sri Lanka first Test, Wasim Jaffer said the India all-rounder is unstoppable in home conditions. "Jadeja is arguably one of the best all-rounders in the world...even overseas, he can perform at number seven the way his batting has improved," he added. India are 1-0 ahead in two-match Test series against Sri Lanka.

379.title: I'll not judge Vihari on what he did on Mohali wicket: Gambhir on 1st Test
379.article_body: Following Hanuma Vihari's 58 in his first innings while batting at number three for India in first Test against Sri Lanka, Gautam Gambhir said he'll not judge Vihari based on his performance in Mohali. "I'll judge him on what he has done overall in Test cricket to date because all batters...even Mohammad Shami, looked comfortable on this pitch," he added.

380.title: Assume tough times ahead, be prepared: Zoho CEO to staff amid Russia-Ukraine war
380.article_body: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu on Monday tweeted some advice that he had shared with this staff amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Vembu wrote, "The world faces many serious challenges…While our company is on a...healthy foundation...we have weathered two serious downturns in our 25-year history...Assume...tough times will be ahead and be prepared…We don't know what lies ahead. Expect turbulent times."

381.title: Power outage in Mumbai's Colaba, electricity restored in phases
381.article_body: Days after a massive power failure in parts of Mumbai, Colaba witnessed a power outage on Sunday night. "Yesterday three 11 kilovolt fault occurred in Colaba area, due to this around 19 Distribution Sub Stations (DSS) were affected," the BEST said. Electricity in 70% of areas was restored immediately, while the remaining places took time.

382.title: Choreographer Tushar Kalia announces engagement to Triveni Barman
382.article_body: Choreographer Tushar Kalia, known for judging 'Dance Deewane' along with actress Madhuri Dixit, on Monday announced his engagement to Triveni Barman. Tushar shared a picture with Triveni on social media, writing, "She said yes. Couldn't have asked for anything else on my birthday." Madhuri along with actress Mouni Roy congratulated the couple in the comment section.

383.title: Priest assaults man for entering Hyd temple's 'prohibited' area, held
383.article_body: A priest has been arrested for assaulting a devotee at a temple in Secunderabad after the man reportedly entered a prohibited area. The incident was said to have taken place on February 27 at Ganesh Temple, when the temple was crowded with devotees and temple staff. The priest allegedly yelled at the victim and even beat him up.

384.title: Rao shares post of man in Hyd hospital, says he'll assist him
384.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister Thanneeru Harish Rao on Sunday shared the post of a man hospitalised in Hyderabad with clotting in his brain and said that his "team would assist" him. The post, originally shared online by an MBT spokesperson, had a picture of 36-year-old Mohd Abdul Rizwan in KIMS Secunderabad. It revealed that the patient is being charged ₹1 lakh/day.

385.title: 929 immunisation booths for kids open from today in Gurugram
385.article_body: 929 immunisation booths for children have opened from today across different health centres as part of a week-long immunisation drive in Gurugram, the district health department said. "Vaccines will be given to children up to the age of 16 years," said district immunisation officer Dr MP Singh. Children can get vaccines for diseases like hepatitis-B, rotavirus, polio and Japanese encephalitis.

386.title: Central GST adjudged winner at inter-office athletics meet in Pune
386.article_body: The Poona inter-office athletics meet was held in Pune's Indrayani Nagar on Sunday. The annual event had competitions such as running, shot put and long jump. Central GST's Akshay Khot won both 100m and 200m events for men while Shyamrao Daundkar won the 400m and 800m events. Meanwhile, Chaitrali Gujar, also of Central GST won the women's 100m event.

387.title: Light rain in Pune on March 8 & 9, cloudy conditions to continue: IMD
387.article_body: Pune will receive light rain on March 8 and 9, according to a report by the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Mornings will have partly cloudy conditions, turning to cloudy skies post afternoon hours over Pune and other areas in the coming days, the report added. Other districts that are likely to experience similar conditions include Sindhudurg, Nashik, Jalgaon and Ahmednagar.

388.title: Delhi Police constable beats dog to death with baseball bat; arrested
388.article_body: A Delhi Police constable allegedly beat a stray dog to death with a baseball bat on Sunday night, following which he has been arrested, officials said. The dog would bark at the policeman and his family every time they passed through the neighbourhood and he felt threatened, officials said. Locals alerted the police after the incident.

389.title: There's stage Madhuri, there's another who's homebody: Madhuri Dixit
389.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has said that there is a stage Madhuri who is in front of the camera and there's another Madhuri who is a homebody. "You lose somebody close to you and that sorrow is right there in you. But then you have to go on a set and do a scene that is the complete opposite," Madhuri added.

390.title: As a captain, I want to use Jadeja a lot more with the bat: Rohit
390.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma said he wants to use all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja "a lot more" with the bat. "We all know his bowling and everyone knows about his fielding. To me, he is one of the top (all-rounders) definitely," Rohit stated. Jadeja scored an unbeaten 175 runs and took nine wickets in the first Test match against Sri Lanka.

391.title: Can't tell you anything as I've no idea: Rohit on why Ashwin didn't play Tests in England
391.article_body: Addressing a reporter's query about Ravichandran Ashwin not being a regular in India's playing XI in away Tests, Rohit Sharma said, "I can't tell you anything about his overseas place." He added, "I honestly have no idea. I wasn't part of selection at that time." Notably, Ashwin wasn't included in any of India's away Tests against England last year.

392.title: It's cheating: BJP MLA on Dabbewala Bhavan's location in Mumbai
392.article_body: BJP MLA Ashish Shelar has criticised the Shiv Sena-led BMC for setting up the Dabbewala Bhavan in Mumbai's Khar area, far away from suburban railway station. Taking to Twitter, Shelar claimed that it was set up by closing an existing COVID-19 vaccination centre and that it was "cheating" with dabbewalas. "BJP will erect...new bhavan...when we come to power," he added.

393.title: Father allegedly kills daughter for refusing to marry man of his choice
393.article_body: Indradeo Ram, along with his two brothers, allegedly slit his 19-year-old daughter's throat after she refused to marry the man of Ram's choice. The daughter's body was later dumped at an agricultural field in Bihar's Kotwa village late on Sunday, police said. Kalawati, Ram's wife, said her daughter wanted to marry another boy, with whom she was supposedly in love.

394.title: Philippines raises age of sexual consent from 12 to 16
394.article_body: Philippines has raised age of sexual consent from 12 to 16, President Rodrigo Duterte's office said on Monday. Under new law, sexual activity between adult and person aged 16 or lower will be considered statutory rape. Exceptions will be made for couples aged over 13 if their age difference doesn't exceed three years and sex is proven to be consensual.

395.title: Angelina in Yemen to aid refugees, calls it worst humanitarian crisis
395.article_body: Actress and philanthropist Angelina Jolie took to Instagram to share that she has reached Yemen's Aden amid what she called "one of the worst humanitarian crises in the world." She wrote in her caption, "As we continue to watch the horrors unfolding in Ukraine...I'm here in Yemen to support people who also desperately need peace.

396.title: BJP MLAs suspended from T'gana Assembly on Budget Session's 1st day
396.article_body: All three BJP MLAs were suspended for the rest of the Telangana Legislative Assembly session on the first day of the Budget Session on Monday. The MLAs were charged with disrupting the budget speech. The MLAs, T Raja Singh, M Raghunandan Rao and Eatala Rajender, later protested outside the Assembly against the suspension.

397.title: Apply for a valid licence to operate cabs in Maharashtra: Bombay HC to Ola, Uber
397.article_body:
The Bombay High Court has directed cab aggregators including Uber India and Ola to apply for a licence under Motor Vehicles Aggregator Guidelines, 2020, to ply their cabs in Maharashtra. It is "complete lawlessness" that aggregators are operating without a valid licence, the court observed.
The court has asked aggregators to apply for a new licence by March 16.

398.title: Maha Council briefly adjourned over call for action against Pune SP
398.article_body: The Maharashtra Legislative Council was adjourned for 10 minutes on Monday after BJP demanded action against Pune SP Abhinav Deshmukh. BJP member Gopichand Padalkar questioned the SP's decision of transferring a constable on the grounds of him having an extramarital affair. "How can the transfer order mention the woman's name...when [it's] regarding the constable", he said.

399.title: He was soft-spoken, made me feel comfortable: Girl who interacted with PM in Pune
399.article_body: Seven-year-old Shreya Gadhve described her interaction with Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his Sunday ride in the Pune Metro as "short but memorable". Gadhve, who's a student of Poona School for Blind Girls, said the PM was very humble and "soft-spoken" and made her feel comfortable. "Modiji even complimented me for my dress," she added.

400.title: Man Utd can't drop any more points in Premier League: Ralf Rangnick
400.article_body: Following a 4-1 loss against Manchester City, Manchester United head coach Ralf Rangnick has said that his side cannot drop points in the Premier League to have a chance for a top-four finish. "We also know that in those 10 games...we have to play, there are a few other difficult ones so let's take it game by game," Rangnick stated.

401.title: There's no contest in Varanasi South, people will elect BJP: MLA
401.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister Neelkanth Tiwari, who is also the incumbent MLA from Varanasi South, said on Monday that there's "no fierce battle" in constituency, adding that people will elect BJP. Tiwari stated that people of Varanasi share special bond with PM Narendra Modi, who has authorised several developmental works. Polling for last phase of UP Assembly elections was held today.
